Reviews.Title: “Hotel staffs may ruin your vacation”
Reviews.Author: 39Mach39
Reviews.Content: I booked the king bed room through Expedia with the confirmation via e mail. The check in started at 4 PM. I arrived around 5 PM. But got the 2 queen bed room with the excuse from the receptionist that Expedia can not promise the customers the room type. And the hotel is not responsible for that reservation. I thought it was a very odd reply, unprofessional, if the hotel registered its business with Expedia then either posting "call hotel directly to confirm/reserve the room type" or else instead of” because you booked with Expedia so they don't know our availability..." (Quote from the receptionist) I also agree with the other review that the house keeper was opening my room around 9 Am when I was about to come outside. I got the door then she excused that she got the wrong room. The parking access and parking space are very tight and one way. Bottom line: if you are particular about the bed type then you better investigate prior...

Reviews.Title: “Cool place on the Marina”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for work. The hotel is very secluded and semi private. Right in the marina on the breakwater but still close enough to walk to Starbucks in the morning. There are several good restaurants close by as well. The hotel itself is landscaped like a tropical jungle and maintained very well. Although it is an older property it has been updated many times and is very comfortable without being worn. The room was large and the bed was comfy. The bathroom was decent sized as was the closet and coffee area. The heating and AC was a bit aged, either on or off with very little control but the weather is so temperate in SD that I only used it to heat the room for about 20 minutes when I got in it then turned it off completely the rest of the night. The restaurant was decent and the bar very lively. Many locals (those that live on the boats in the marina) party in the bar as there are bands nearly every night. A quiet drink and conversation is out of the question as the volume is fairly high. I could definitely stay here again for a quiet weekend away. Not the most glamorous but very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: JILLPILL
Reviews.Content: Just got back and this place was really great. Stayed in room 438, which had 2 queen beds. The room looked over the harbor and was very quiet. The room was really clean, and came with a microwave and fridge. The restaurant was very good and also had a really great view. I loved staying here and will not stay anywhere else. In response to the poor review on March 18th, the room comes with 6 pillows per bed, and the pillows were all different kinds so you can pick which was best to sleep on. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not sleep bed hard as a rock”
Reviews.Author: Kent2009
Reviews.Content: The good: nice location Nice view Restaurant -delicious food The bad: bed is terrible very hard Pillows were also bad, hard Restaurant - service was bad. Waiter was rushing us Gym/exercise room old,equipments were too old but functional Tv in the gym was too old barely see the picture Recommendation: Upgrade the gym, flat screen are cheap nowadays, need new equipments Better bed and pillow Better customer service in the restaurant Would not stay again unless they would have a better bed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: bmwang
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on the hotels around this area and found Humphreys with the best reviews. We had a 2-night stay for a family of five, in their Grand Marina Suite. The suite was huge - it has one bedroom with two queen beds, one bathroom, two pull-out sofa sleepers in the living room, a formal dining room and a big kitchen. The view was so beautiful. The beds were comfortable and we hardly heard any noises from neighbors. The location of this hotel is awesome too. Shelter Island has very little traffic, and it is close to everything we need. We drove to Sea World within 10 minutes. We also drove to Seaport Village to take the Seal Bus and Trolly to Old Town. It was a beautiful and relaxing weekend with affordable stay in Humphreys. We loved it and will strongly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service !!”
Reviews.Author: Yo S
Reviews.Content: Just beautiful, the grounds are beautifully manicure, the pool was heated and the room was very clean the service was outstanding !!! The restaurant the best Sunday brunch and great Jazz music on Saturday night. Can wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Funky older Hawaiian-style property, well maintained and affordable in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Ricomalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an upstairs suite with a straight shot to the pool area, #424 if memory serves. The room was large with a nice balcony facing the Shelter Island boat basin and a large clean two-sinked bathroom with modern fixtures. Furniture was comfortable and the kitchen well-apportioned. The property is a mature well-maintained tropical garden and the pool is large and deep with a big Jacuzzi. We really enjoyed the pool area! The restaurant seemed newer and more upscale than the property in general and the breakfast was delicious, again with a nice view of the boat basin. I've stayed in all kinds of places all over the world but the the room service menu prices at Humphreys were so ridiculously high that we had a fun time reading them aloud. I can't remember seeing room service prices this high. The restaurant prices were reasonable and the food was good and the hotel price is really quite a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staycation!!”
Reviews.Author: Kayt121966
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a weekend. The grounds are very lush and tropical. The rooms are huge and newly remodeled. The lounge has great happy hour specials and the restaurant is good as well. Definitely reccomend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Tai K
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn a couple of times and will whenever we are in San Diego! The personnel are always friendly and helpful; from the front desk to the bar. The rooms are clean and very comfortable.The grounds are like walking through a Tiki garden and I understand that there are Tikis hidden throughout; I found 5 so far. Don't forget to ask for a free bike rental and tour Shelter Island and surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: yrholly
Reviews.Content: Living in the suburbs of San Diego, it is easy to forget just what special experiences are right at hand. As longtime customers of the two music venues at Humphreys ( the Outdoor Concerts and the Backstage Lounge,) we often thought about staying at Humphreys Half Moon Inn and turning a great Friday or Saturday night of music into a weekend getaway. We had the opportunity to do just that two weeks ago, and the experience was top notch. From the six hours of music, to the always-outstanding restaurant, to the absolutely stunning second floor suite overlooking the bay and harbor, it could not have been any better. If you are from out of town visiting the area, this is the definition of San Diego experience. If you live here and are looking for that local vacation, you don't need to look any further.My husband and I are alreading planning our next weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, lovely grounds and responsive staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SamRuiz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at Humphrey's. The staff was amazing and very responsive to our requests. Scott, director of facilities, really took great care of us and made us feel completely in good hands during our entire stay. The front desk was great at helping us coordinate taxi requests, wake up calls, way in advance. The room was great with a king-size bed, two lcd tv's and a great little balcony/patio area where I could take advantage of the beautiful view of the San Diego Bay every morning. The layout of the room was fantastic with a mini sink, fridge, and microwave area separating the sleeping quarters and the living-room (great place to relax in-between adventures). The grounds at Humphrey's are beautifully well maintained making it a pleasure to walk around. The pool area is impeccably clean and a great place to relax and meet travelers from other parts of the country. The restaurant - bar was really happening with live music and great food. I plan to come back to San Diego and stay at Humphrey's because of its location, rooms and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but a pathetic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea80525
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting at Humphrey's, so my husband and I stayed at the hotel. The landscaping is lovely, but the buildings and parking are a joke. We reserved a king room and were told we had been "upgraded". We were given a room with two full (not queen) beds. I see from other reviews this is a common ploy at Humphrey's. We went back and insisted on a king room and were given one. Both rooms we saw had been "renovated" but they still had an outdated feel, with cheap carpet and noisy air conditioners. The linens were of good quality and plentiful, however. The parking seems to be a big problem too. I don't think the charge for parking is unfair, but if they charge they need to provide a space. Everyone seems to be crammed together at one end. Additionally, the shuttle driver wanted to park in the spot we were in. Instead of just asking us to move (or clearly marking the space) he made up a story about it being an illegal spot so we would move. He then parked in the "illegal" spot 30 seconds later. The whole placed seemed very "halfway". Humphrey's is pretending to be a nice place, but they are seem to be putting all of their effort into the landscaping. Don't bother staying until they decide to work on being a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay there”
Reviews.Author: gailpassen
Reviews.Content: After paying for an upgrade for a garden room...we unfortunately had to hear loud music constantly! One night there was a party on the green..(which is where they hold concerts) and trying to get a good nights sleep was impossible. Even though the music was supposed to end at 9:30, we had a early flight back east the next day, and could not relax in our room. I can only guess how bad it is in season when they have concerts!!! If you do not want to sleep, and want to hear loud music at night...stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “And Im FROM Hawaii !!!”
Reviews.Author: beachkind
Reviews.Content: AWESOM place. Simular to Hilton Hawaiian Village on a intimate scale. front desk were promt and sharp. Our suite harbor view was great, overlooking the stage, I could imagine, a birds eye view in my robe, watching Paul McCartney (well not sure about the robe but that would be unique), oh also, what a deal, you can purchase a monogrammed robe for only $25 ! Our room was GREAT, clean, the dark wood shutters, very tropical. we had room service dinner nice, they called us asked too see if were ready then they were there in 2 minutes...HOT food yum, menu was actually reasonable. pool mid feb was warm, jacuzzi clean an HOT, yum. everywhere you go the staff is "aloha" friendly. Dawn Sanders, guest relations was very attentive, If your a ceo etc, its always good to make contact with managment beforehand and let them know you look forward to your stay, they make sure its a perfect stay. also know where your going, this place is a Tahitian style CASUAL luxery, there are NO ten foot tall stilletto vegas art. Humpreys is a GEM. restaurant and club are FUNNNN. another REALLLLLLLY cool thing is in front across the street is San Deigo Bay, military ships...sail boats....LOTS of action for fun viewing. We cant wait to go back. Mahalo HHMI

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: woody_43925
Reviews.Content: Location was great. Room was good. Mattress was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “world class business class vacation resort!”
Reviews.Author: solotravelergir2012l
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to the area, I was here for business, had to work in Tijuana. Had two days to myself before work began. Resort is beautiful. Pool is beautiful and is open all night but not at all noisey. The room is all that you need. King bed, big flat screen, frige, microwave, and great water pressure...even in the morning, very clean, very nice. I had a room looking over the pool. There is a patio outside of the room surrounded by shrubs so I had a sense of privcacy inspite of the pool. The Inn is 15 minutes from the Zoo, Sea World, Downtown, LaJolla, the ocean and great shopping. Also, I was just a 30 minute drive, without traffic, to the Otay border crossing. Park for ten dollars a day, someone from work picked me up and two seconds to cross sthe border into Mexico. Coming home at the end of the day was a bit different. I was dropped at the border gate, three nights no line to cross, over in two minutes and then a two block walk to my car. The other two nignts there was a very long line waiting to cross. Thirty minutes in line with my Kindle wasn't bad at all. Many people but it moves really fast. So, what I'm saying is this is a vacation resort but the most relaxing and enjoyable place for a business traveler. The Humphreys Half Moon restaurant is fabulous and withing walking distance are sever other equally GREAT places of reasonable price. Downtown is a great place to go, the Gaslamp area, Little Italy...terrific restaurants but a bit pricey for the business traveler. The staff? Never saw them. I left my room in the morning and when I came back everything was in place. I never locked up a thing of mine and nothing was touched or disturbed. Never asked for room service but did ask for extra hangers and pillows...no problem. Can't wait to get back. I've already told my friends. This place is just wonderful. Thank you Humphreys Half Moon Inn.

Reviews.Title: “BAD Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: travelergirl08
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are nice, with beautiful views, however the service provided is not worth the view. I stayed here for my wedding (along with MANY other guests) where I got the largest suite possible to get ready in on my wedding day. We left the room in a whirlwind, and we came back 7 hours later to the same mess in the room! We had to call to have maid service once we got back, when housekeeping came the lady pilled up a stack of clean towels on the counter and left. She did not take away the dirty towels, take out the trash or make the bed. We then had to call back AGAIN just to have someone clean up for us, meanwhile a friend had to clean the whole kitchen for us because she would not. Then a large group of us (30 people) tried to go to the restaurant/bar on the property to continue celebrating our wedding, however upon arrival the manager was VERY RUDE to one of my guest, speaking to her in a way no one in the customer service industry ever should (And I would know because I have been in the industry for some time). When I tried to speak to her, she was VERY Rude to me as well. I was later told other guests from my wedding tried to make their way to the restaurant/bar and had terribly rude service as well. Basically that night they lost over 40 people's revenue they could have had! I tried speaking to a manager of the hotel that evening (yes, still in my wedding dress!) who did nothing besides look at me like I was an idiot. And to cap it all off, the morning after the wedding, when we are checking out the maid comes bright and early at 9 am to clean! HAH! I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, beautiful setting close to airport & transit”
Reviews.Author: lilbirds
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Humphreys very much. Was exactly what we needed... Landscaping is fantastic, great for family photos, saw the parrots this time and the giant koi. Being midwinter, it was very peaceful and quiet (no concerts at this time), and we loved that our room had a patio facing the marina. Great view to enjoy your morning coffee by. Staff were also very accomodating to change our room to ground level (we had a stroller) and to put grandparents in the neighboring room! Heated pool open to 11pm was nice way to end the day too. We also didn't have a car which was one primary reason we stayed here, it's close to Bus 28 stop (5 min walk) and has free airport shuttle. Room was nicely updated with microwave and coffee machine, bathroom had no tub but nice modern sink and decent shower. No free breakfast or parking, but this wasn't an issue for us (no car), also you can get coffee and pastries a few blocks away. Nice restaurants nearby, too, for dinner - Brigantine, Pomodoro, Irish pub etc. Airport shuttle was quick and fast. We had stayed at neighboring hotels on Shelter Island before & they also have their pluses, but for this trip Humphreys met our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded retreat”
Reviews.Author: Anniebonnie
Reviews.Content: A really large suite on the water, with a central pool surrounded by exotic vegetation, and conviently located. Just close enough to most attractions but slightly out of the main traffic areas. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Polynesian Architecture Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rome949
Reviews.Content: If you are a a Tikiphlle, or just love a place that transports you off to the south seas, then this is the place to visit. The resort was built in 1962 and has the perfect tropical feel. It is located on Harbor Island in San Diego and has spectacular views of the marina as well as downtown San Diego views. Within the resort you will find a huge pool with spa, tropical gardens, water falls, a small pond with ducks, macaw parotts and koi fish. Also located throughout the complex are hidden tikis. Humphrey's offers large rooms, very nicely appointed. Huge flat screen tv and a beautiful bathrooms. Happy hour can be had at the bar/lounge area with 1/2 price drinks and food. Live entertainment is enjoyable while you have pleasant views of the marina and boats. The resort is very clean and very well maintained. Also found on the property is an outdoor concert venue. I hear there are great shows there. What a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic!!!! Worth coming back time & time again! 9/17-20/11”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette S
Reviews.Content: We celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary. What a beautiful Inn, from the setting,to our room,breath taking views,everyone was so personable, treated us like family,complimentary champagne and 2 truffles. So much to do, complimentary bike rides, to walking to the ocean to enjoy a kayaking trip,we saw shark tanks in the water,sea lions. We had an amazing time. Sea world,Zoo. Please do NOT miss Sundays brunch @ Humphreys ask for Nancy! We are looking forward to Sept! Thank you to everyone, Wayne & Jeanette

Reviews.Title: “IF ONLY....”
Reviews.Author: Marionemberson
Reviews.Content: I could give it TEN stars !!! The setting is gorgeous, the free bike hire was great. I've never met such lovely happy staff, the complimentary breakfast was an added bonus. I would definitely come back here, just a shame it's 6000 miles from home :)

Reviews.Title: “Scenic”
Reviews.Author: suraleh
Reviews.Content: The location on the marina enhanced our stay. The oversized marina suite was huge, clean and homey.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed coming back--this time with a group!”
Reviews.Author: Petite1Redding
Reviews.Content: My family rented a Grand Mariner suite (the same one we had last year, thanks to the hotel staff) and the room next two it with the adjoining door. We brought others from our city to attend a business function and they rented about half a dozen rooms. Everyone was happy with the accommodations and loved the beautiful grounds. Don't be surprised if we don't return with even more friends.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Haley M
Reviews.Content: I live in Southern California but wanted to get away for a few days. By researching deals and ratings, I found Humphreys and there was a really good 48 hour sale going on. The reviews were pretty respectable so I settled on it. Check in was really smooth, and the front desk was very helpful. They gave a map so that we could easily find our room, they gave us a menu so we could see some of the dishes that their restaurant offered (Which was good so that I could see if it was worth going there since I don't like seafood), and we heard recommendations being made as to other things we should do whilst there. After reading reviews from others at different hotels, I was relieved that I didn't have to prove that I had paid for the room or anything (although I had the paperwork all ready to go just in case). The place itself was not very far from everything, and the view of the marina was absolutely beautiful. We didn't see any of the concerts by the bay while we were there but the area was big and hopefully we'll do that next time. PARKING: We found the room, and on a Wednesday we had no problem parking near our room at all (Parking is an extra ten dollars a night). Parking did get a bit crazy by Thursday night and Friday, so that's when you'll want to get back a bit early (although the walk isn't far at all it's just less convenient when you have to check out in the morning). THE GROUNDS: The grounds are very nice, with one exception being the area Caution-stripped out but that didn't bother me. I felt really safe while I was here. We were able to walk the grounds at night and we didn't feel nervous at all. We saw other people but there were no rowdy and loud voices, suspicious activity or anything like that. The only time there was a good amount of noise was in the morning because people were waking up and whatnot. There was a small fitness center located under the Ballroom by the bay, which was perfect during the week especially when everything was quite empty. The pool was unexpectedly big and I was very happy with the effect. Make sure to walk around and find the parrots that hang out above the koi pond! ROOM: The room itself was a renovated Premier King room. The bed was comfortable, the TV was a good size and had HDMI so I could plug in my phone for my own movies. There were three lamps and each turned on differently, but they were set up in a very convenient way. There is a complimentary Nintendo Gamecube in the room that can be played 60 minutes for around 7 dollars (games can be chosen on screen), which I thought was really funny and cool. The decoration was very pretty and I enjoyed the white bedspread as opposed to the cheap looking floral you see in other places. The bathroom was nice and the fan was really quiet. The bed was wonderfully spacious, although it wasn't as comfortable as back home... Now I want a king size bed. I do wish I could have found a TV guide or something since the channels were completely different than they are in the Inland Empire so I had to go through one by one to find anything. Not a big deal, just something I thought I would mention. The little patio area was wonderful because it was covered by plants and things so that we had privacy, whereas there were others that were just completely out in the open. I was very happy and surprised to see that they had a mini fridge and a microwave in the room. They came in handy the entire stay, and the fridge wasn't bulked up with anything which meant that I didn't have to remember what was mine and what was extra. Housekeeping did an amazing job every time they were there. No old towels were left, and the first day we used pretty much all of the little shampoo and conditioner and they were replaced with twice as many bottles the next day without our asking for it. Oh, and ice being free was great! LOBBY: Check out time being at 12? Marvelous! I had plenty of time to wake up normally, get ready for my day and check out. Check out was smooth and quick, there were smiles and more tips from the woman at the front desk. I saw three people behind the desk during my stay and all were quick to offer up tips and suggestions. They seemed very knowledgeable and didn't seem like they were grinding their teeth behind their smiles. OVERALL: I had a wonderful stay at Humphreys and I definitely plan on being back here. I was honestly sad when I had to leave my room. This place was perfect for me and my boyfriend, and we congratulated ourselves on a job well done with picking this beautiful place. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: JBack719
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight on a road trip from Las Vegas and were pleasantly suprised upon arrival. We chose this hotel based on the amazing location, and equally as important...the tropical setting which was in stark contrast with the typical Vegas views. The half moon was beautifully landscaped with a lush Polynesian/Hawiian/tropical feel, and the rooms were very clean and simply decorated to match the vibe. Also, the staff was both helpful and friendly. Views from right outside were amazing, day and night. We were worried about noise from the airport due to viewing google maps, however, we did not hear one plane the entire time, and could only hear military choppers when out at shoreline park, maybe once or twice. It is a very relaxing and peaceful place to be. Now the bad. Maybe we are spoiled from our bed at home, but the beds were the least comfortable we have slept on in years, and this is after driving and sightseeing since 430 am. Also, the pool and spa were relaxing, but could have and should have been cleaner, as some algae was present, but we soaked anyway, and so did several others. Conclusion: definitely not 5star luxury, but a great place to stay if you do not need to be in the fanciest hotel, but want to relax in peace. Very convenient location, we would go back if we knew the beds were better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: scubapro
Reviews.Content: We stayed eight nights from the 23rd of Dec - 31st. When we got there my wife had contracted the flu on the way and was coughing like crazy. I told the clerk and she upgraded me to a one bedroom suite so we could get a little separation so one of us could get some sleep. (ME)! She also tipped us off on a quick med place nearby and some other things. The room was nice, had a view over the marina. Large sitting area a pocket door separates the bedroom from the kitchen and sitting area. Nice bath, marble etc. Just a plain shower but it was fine. They will charge you 10 dollars a day for parking, however you could park on the street for free if you wanted to and would only have to walk a short distance to your room if you wanted to save a few bucks. There are gates going in and out of the parking lot which are kind of a hassle so street parking would not really have been much more of an inconvenience. They had specials every night at the lounge with good music acts every night. The only thing I didn't like about that was the fact that the place was pretty small, the band very loud and it was pretty dark. Not my thing for dining. The restaurant itself is good. We had a couple of meals there and it was fine. Nothing to go crazy about but for Shelter Island it was good. So was Brigantines right up the street. The room cleaning service was prompt every morning and they always did a great job. We looked at the pool but it was only about 65 degrees each day and there were people over there early in the morning laying out in the 55 degree weather? Beats me? They must have been from the north pole. All in all it was a great QUIET location away from the hustle and bustle, but not far away. I'll be back for sure. They also have free bicycles you can borrow for two hours at a time which is nice to mosey around shelter island on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing quality & great location”
Reviews.Author: teamlove
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and landscaped grounds. Perfect spot to get to Sea World & the Zoo and also located on the water. Heated pool, ping pong table, free bike rentals .... Can't imagine a bad stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere Between Poor & Average”
Reviews.Author: starannies
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were told our room was upgraded. We went from a room with a king size bed to a room with two queens. I don't know what made the room an upgrade but we decided not to press it. There was no soap to wash my hands when we first arrived and as a very clean person, this grossed me out. My husband tried calling them but they would not answer their phone so he had to go stand in the long line again to get soap. The air conditioning in the room was a joke. It provided more noise than air. We would be sweating all night, then walk out in the morning to discover it was actually cool outside. The ocean winds serve as a better cooling system. The sheets were cheap, not at all what you would expect from what we expected to be a highend hotel. The views from our room were of the pool. It was not as close to the water as it appeared online and the views were what justified the high price for us. The location was okay but not spectacular. Soaking in the hottub was nice. When we told locals where we were staying, they wrinkled their nose and said "That place is...expensive. Isn't it?" Yep. Not worth the price. We will be back to San Diego but not to Humphreys.

Reviews.Title: “Lower than expectations, maybe we picked the wrong room type??”
Reviews.Author: Koffs
Reviews.Content: Decided to book the Tropical queen room after reviewing glossy pictures on internet and finding holiday discounts. Not sure what the tropical view was supposed to be as our room faced a deteriorating retaining wall. I almost thought we were given wrong room at first, but furniture and bedding were as pictured. The grounds are quite tropical and we enjoyed a couple of evening swims in the heated pool and hot tub. Walked to Red Sail inn one evening for dinner, food was good, service was great and happened to be the evening for half price bottles of wine. There were several restaurants within walking distance, although we did not make it to the restaurant onsite. Kind of strange that we lost power (electrical breaker problem?) in our suite twice, once when making coffee and a second time using blow dryer. Staff at front desk were good and had this fixed fairly quickly. Overall the room felt a bit old and ours did not even have the wood plantations shutters as shown on internet. The bathroom was updated with granite and double vessel sinks. Although the area itself is scenic and relaxing and even though we are not particularly picky, the room really felt a bit small and dingy. Probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our mission is to return - ASAP!”
Reviews.Author: mamajojoYork
Reviews.Content: Two nights stay here just isn't enough. The rooms are faboulous, fashioned as though inspired by boats and marinas (which indeed they are as the location is right beside a beautiful marina with awesome boats). The rooms are modern, huge, beamed with wood and have gorgeous views over either the marina or the central oasis-style grounds and pool. We had nibbles in the bar and it was kind of nice that at 7pm children are barred, making the bar a properly grown-up zone, for gentle drinks and nibbles accompanied by what mostly seem to be live cheesy jazz/blue combos. I liked this! But would love to go back in-season when the hotel's very own concert venues hosts proper big-name artists (Stevie Wonder, Aretha Franklin...) And the location is great - San Diego old town, Sea World etc just minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base of Operations for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Azands
Reviews.Content: Easy access to everything, including a moonlight walk along the bay. All the ammenities with a big plus for us being a wonderful, hopping, lounge. We truly enjoyed ending our touristy days with a drink and dance at the lounge. They had live bands, blues bands, every night we were there, and each gave energy and life to the place. The hotel is great, but the lounge will bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: sdavis144
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for three nights at the resort and can hardly wait to stay again. It is beautiful, restful, and they treat you well. It is clean, quiet, and the views are amazing. We got a great deal too. And from the hotel itself. No booking company needed. The you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Worked Well for Us”
Reviews.Author: Pahoot
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a very good deal for what we paid. We were only sleeping at the hotel and while we were very disappointed initially at the location of the room, across from the ice machine, bordering on the vending machines and facing the parking lot, it was immaculate and served our purpose well. Despite the location of the room, it was very quiet. The location of the hotel is very good in that it is close to a lot we wanted to do but away from the noise that so often accompanies a city stay. The decor was nice - the room had recently been renovated and it showed. Good sized room and bathroom, comfortable pillows and bed. We did have a small patio area surrounded by tall plantings that gave a bit of privacy from the parking lot. The grounds were beautiful. I would definitely stay here again and at the great price we got, the room was definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica P
Reviews.Content: Humphreys is very ideally located in San Diego for someone looking for a great getaway. It's close enough to the airport that they offer a free shuttle service (and E. (Elliot I think?) has fantastic recommendations for you on the ride there), but still nestled away enough that you don't feel like you're in the middle of a city - yet everything is still close by. It was perfect for me because I did not want to be near hundreds of tourists with kids going to SeaWorld and the zoo - I just wanted a peaceful vacation. I travelled with my handicap step-mom and they were very polite and accommodating for her - so thank you to all the staff for their help with that! You can honestly tell that the staff love their jobs and I cannot emphasize enough how much I felt like I was at an island resort instead of being boxed in at a cookie cutter hotel. For rooms, I recommend getting one that is towards the pier, and the suites looked amazing. I was on a budget though and stayed in a regular room. Despite the price (super cheap), the room was still very spacious, and included all the amenities that a traveler needs there for a 4 night stay. A little older, more noticeably in the bathrooms but the SUPER comfortable beds completely made up for it! All in all, I am completely glad I read these review - it helped me make the decision and I strongly recommend others to book with Humphrey's also! Hint - I got a great deal with Expedia, couldn't find any with orbitz or bookit with Humphrey's.

Reviews.Title: “How can you not LOVE Humphreys Half Moon Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: 1Bedhead
Reviews.Content: Amazing waterview suites are HUGE! The biggest in town!! Great property, Great Restaurant, From the grounds to the staff. AAA++++ Every time! and a perfect distance from the downtown craziness!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jhudson8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a couple time and have loved it. We stayed there for our wedding in the Grand Maria Suite and it was so comfortable family frendly with a full kitchen and dining room with a table that seats 8. Our wedding photos turned our wonderful. We also enjoyed free Santana coverband concert during our stay. Cant say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful landscape”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night, on our way to Mexico. The property is beautifully landscaped with mature palms and other tropical plants, since this place is 40 years old and has been remodeled. In spite of the remodeled rooms, this place is old and it shows. It is located in a lovely location and we loved walking along the bay. The hotel offers free 2 hour bikes to ride around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Pinkawesome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Nov, we stayed in a newly renovated room and it was nice, clean with a large bed, the pool area is nice, we had breakfast in the morning at the restaurant very nice views, I ordered a continental breakfast and all I got was toast and a coffee for $9.95, when I questioned if I ordered toast and coffee separate it came to $5.00 I just got shoulder shrugged off the waitress and told that's how it is. There is a bar with live music every night which has a good happy hour and some good live music.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrades required!!”
Reviews.Author: shelbear
Reviews.Content: We just spent the past Thanksgiving weekend at this property and felt that it was just okay. The location is wonderful and we had the most beautiful view overlooking the harbor. Which I would like to say far outweighed the negative. BUT, we stayed in a marina view suite (rm422) which was very large but really required some upgrades. The king sized bed was really very nice but the hide a bed has seen better days. The kitchen is very outdated with only a new counter top. The bathroom was relatively new but the little trail of ants made us think that housekeeping was not very thorough. A bit of a musty smell as you entered the room. Now, in saying all this , I think this hotel would be a riot to stay at during a concert, although I would avoid the "very dirty" hot tub and swimming pool. We had also requested ground floor but were told that they weren't available. Although we did check numerous ground floor rooms and they seemed to be unoccupied. All in all, I probably would recommend this hotel to budget conscious families or concert goers but discerning folks please avoid and stay at the Dana or Paradise Point.

Reviews.Title: “Concert lovers dream!”
Reviews.Author: Kshouper
Reviews.Content: Came to see a Billy Idol concert and completely fell in love with this hotel/concert venue! Loved it so much we booked the follow week for the Gavin DeGraw/David Cook concert! Not only is there not a bad seat in the concert venue the hotel room that we got had a balcony facing the stage!! We got there early and got to hear and see the sound check for each show. Jen, who works the front desk is super helpful and has customer service down to a tee!! I'd hire her for my own business!! The suite we were assigned was clean, comfortable, huge and PERFECT! The restaurant is great, lots of food choices and excellent staff! Everyone was so great there...I would highly recommend this property! Great views, fun location, awesome staff! Pure perfection!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: dbscruz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and really like the location and this hotel. I found a great rate online and booked with a request for a water view room on the 2nd floor with a balcony. I was given exactly what I requested. I also arrived at 9:00 a.m. on check-in day, and they allowed me to check in that early. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room had a nice view and the bed was very comfortable. One thing I hadn't remembered from previous visits is that they charge $10/day for parking a car at the hotel. This is the only negative thing I have to say at all about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little resort”
Reviews.Author: SMack048
Reviews.Content: This us a nice hotel with a good restaurant overlooking a marina. It's a few minutes drive from downtown San Diego, feels like a special place to stay but isn't really close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “I must go back there!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jobloggs_37
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, in a great setting, close to sea world and San Diego zoo. Restaurant was lovely with harbour views at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chesterhouse3
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group at this hotel for a recent NFL Packer road trip. WeI arrived a day early though and we were pleased with the complimentary airport pick up, the pleasant staff, the location the beautiful pool area. I'm sure this hotel wasn't used to having a group of Wisconsin fans staying there but they made special arrangements to have the pool area bar open for us, set up buffet breakfasts, etc. the group overall would have preferred a little more variety on the breakfast buffet but again, don't think they were ready for 120 plus people wanting toast, etc. But other than that, we thought the location was great, beautiful marinas, views across the street were beautiful and lots of sidewalks aroudn so you could walk to the waterfront, other nearby restaurants, etc. The hotel is an older hotel but you can see their efforts to keep it very clean and our housekeeping staff gave us extra coffee, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: shortyvaca
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and staff. The location is beautiful, but it was really the staff that went above abd beyond. I booked a trip to San Diego and stayed for 4 days. I had another couple flying in from Seattle and we were coming from Minneapolis. The hotel took care of shuttle/taxi and arrangements for rental car when requested. They also assissted with tour and dining choices. If we had a question, they were right there to assisst. The best part is they were so helpful before the trip as well. We completely surprised my husband! He had no idea this was planned becasuse the hotel was very careful on communication and only called my cell phone directly to respond to request. Until we landed, he did not realize out friend were arriving as well! Thanks again Humphrey's!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, average room.”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettHoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the room came w/ our expensive Humphrey's Concert seats. It was clean, small and uneventful. I went to the pool after the show. I loved it. Great pool!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: jnburnett
Reviews.Content: This hotel has lots of personality! It is very beautiful, with lush tropical flowers and plants all over the property. you feel like you are at a tropical resort without it looking tacky or fake. Many of the rooms have a view of the marina and even the ones that don't still have a nice view of the plants and flowers. The rooms are very clean, neat and spacious (the suites are very nice and roomy with excellent views!). They are actually homey and comfortable wo you don't feel like you are in one of those generic hotels that feel sterile and without personality. I liked that the restaurant has free live music every night, and it is a different band every night. They also hold larger concerts there too. And the food is wonderful and reasonably priced! They have one of the top 20 brunches in the country, which unfortunately i missed, but I hear they even have crab legs and lobster on their brunch buffets on Sundays! I would definately reccommend this hotel for couples or families. All of the couches in the rooms have pull out beds to accommodate more people. They also have areas set up to do wedding ceremonies and have several meeting rooms for receptions, reunions or other corporate meetings. This is a nice and relaxing place to stay, away from all the hustle and bustle of downtown. Also, I should mention that the staff were all friendly and always eager to help. One of the nice ladies at the reception area even called another hotel for me (where I had stayed at the previous night) because I had left my phone charger there.

Reviews.Title: “Humphreys the jewel in the crown”
Reviews.Author: Georgina D
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews before booking this hotel and most of the reviews were good and lived up to our expectations. Humphreys hotel is definitely a great place to stay. All staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are well equipped, spacious and clean. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The view from the restaurant overlooking the marina was tranquil. We also found it very easy to get around on the buses and trolleys. Restaurants nearby were very good too. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Just a little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mrsthfc
Reviews.Content: Dont really know why, but somehow the property didnt live up to our expectations. We were given a ground floor room facing the car park (although you couldnt see it, it was shaded by shrubbery). The room was a renovated one, really clean & tidy, but a bit gloomy due to our patio area being so shaded. Something I really didnt like was the fact the room was interconnected, and on our first night the neighbours had a very good attempt at entering our room. It was very un-nerving. They were obviously drinking, having a good time and luckily this was the only night of our stay that we heard any noise from them. The grounds are very well kept and look lovely. The pool area is nice, you have to use your key to enter. Shame no-one told the ducks that joined us in the pool every afternoon. Some people found this fun, but I dont really like sharing a pool with several ducks. Didnt like them coming right up to us on the loungers either, specially when they left a 'deposit' We only used the restaurant for breakfast once, it was nice enough but just as good but cheaper is the Red Sails, just down the road. We had a car so went out for dinner most evenings, but it was lovely to come back and then walk along the seafront at night. Although parking is busy when concerts are on, they do keep a section for guests only so we never had trouble getting a space. The property is out of the way, but there are a couple of nice restaurants in walking distance, they dont look much from the outside but are really nice inside and the food is good. I dont think we would stay here again, next time we would like Coronado, there was a much nicer feel to that area.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: queenjansson
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice nothing special but the property was beautiful, I've never been to Hawiii but it felt like My husband and I were in a Tropical Setting. The Staff was ok not over friendly but for the most part enjoyed my stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “What a peaceful Place”
Reviews.Author: Welshtravellerboy
Reviews.Content: After spending 7 nights in anaheim this place was a great place to unwind for a few days. Rooms were spacious and well equiped, grounds were well maintained and the views from the island across the bay was spectacular. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Simon L
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. Great rooms. Gorgeous gardens. Beautiful pool and hot tub. And perfect location for visiting Bali Hai.

Reviews.Title: “Half Moon is a Full treat..”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBird
Reviews.Content: Splendid property! Check in was friendly & quick, but not rushed. My room request found me in a Jr. Suite on the second floor with a nice view of the bay and clear sounds of the concert which was a bit of an unplanned surprise. Brian at the bell stand got me on a sweet pink beach cruiser (complementary!) For an hour long ride around Shelter Island & into Point Loma. The putting greens looked well maintained although I didn't make use of them. The pool & spa area are very pretty, very tropical setting, perfect for relaxing or playing table tennis. Junior suite has a seperate seating space~ table & chairs (slight wear & tear on upholstery) sofa (pull out sleeper? I didn't check) coffee table, reading lamp & big flat screen tv. Balcony was clean, 2 chairs & small table. Cool feature in the room was a bar area~ microwave, sink & fridge. Bathroom was well lit & ventilated, nice massaging shower head, soft but small towels. Washroom was outside of the shower/toilet, not a fan of that design feature, but no points lost for it. King size bed had great big fluffy pillows, extra blankets & pillows in the closet and another flat screen tv. Thank you Humphrey's for getting rid of the ick hotel comforters & having only fresh white sheets~ I always appreciate that. Parking is available, will fill on concert nights and is a little tight if you are parking a larger vehicle. Getting on/off property during concerts means you are walking through ticket only areas, but we were never stopped or asked to go in a different direction. Hotel staff & security were clearly visable & available to help get around during the show. Cigarette butts litter some areas of this nonsmoking property, shame, and the same room service dish sat outside my neighbors door from my check in at 5pm to my checkout at 8am. The guest room was very tidy, no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “Half Moon was Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rizman58
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ Humphreys October of 2011. We went to San Diego for a wedding. We stayed a Thursday thru Monday in one of their Grand Marina Suites. The room was fantastic very clean & lots of room. We were on the 2nd. floor great view of the Marina. The hotel is minutes from the airport. Shelter Island is very nice. If you like mexican food go to Miguels mexican restraurant walking distance from the hotel. The hotel also has stage shows. For our stay George Lopez was the entertainment for two nights. If you don't want to spring for the tickets, you can clearly hear the shows from the pool area, just grab a seat and enjoy. We spent one night in the lounge and danced all night with a band that was playing dance music from the 70's & 80's. Both my wife and I give Humphreys two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: 372kevin372
Reviews.Content: This is a very good place to stay, your very near all the best actrations & its just a lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: TopCats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphreys this September after getting a reccomendation from a work collegue. We were not disappointed. On arrival the reception staff where efficient and courteous and on entry to our room we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us with a Birthday card for my Wife. We had mentioned in advance the trip was part of a 50th Birthday treat. We had a Marina view suite which suited us perfectly, and large and spacious.The room could have doen with a bit of attention - there were signs of wear and tear here and there, but this did not detract from our stay. Beds where comfortable and the kitchen well equipped. Humphrey's have an open air stage, which can either be a blessing or a curse depending on your point of view. For us it was a blessing as we where two doors down from the rear of the stage. We enjoyed Tears for Fears, Diana Ross (Yes THE Diana Ross) and Three Dog Night playing while we where there. As the concerts don't go on too late this didn't spoil our sleep either. There is a restaurant on site which does very good breakfasts, although a little pricey ($20 each). We didn't use the restaurant in the evenings, though it was reccomended to us. The pool area is the the centre of the hotel and a good space - we never needed to fight for sun beds. The location of Shelter island is a good one, with plenty of small local restaurants and bars within walking distance of the hotel. The airport and downtown areas are a short car ride away too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary stay”
Reviews.Author: DTierman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely love Humphreys Half Moon Inn. We live locally and try and stay at least once per year (usually to celebrate our anniversary). This year we stayed September 17, 2011 and had a wonderful stay. We were surprised at check in to receive an awesome upgrade and a nice bottle of champagne from Melissa Garibay, Reservation Manager. It certainly made our anniversary even more special. The entire staff is very professional and always very friendly and helpful. The reception staff was gracious and efficient. The grounds remind my husband and I of Hawaii! The hotel restaurant is wonderful with a gorgeous view but if you prefer there are many other restaurants within easy walking distance. The location is perfect. We even go down to the area with our lawn chairs to enjoy the bay on Sunday afternoons. There is so much to see. I am already looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Katelin T
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the most amazing I have ever had the pleasure of staying in! It is in a beautiful location along the marina. They offer 2 hour free bike rentals so my boyfriend and I took a ride along the bay! The girl at the front desk was extremley nice and when we called down to the desk for a towel it was at our room within minutes! The rooms are lovely and the beds are really comfortable. Close to everything and in such a beautiful town. This hotel makes me want to come back to San Diego just to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concert, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: runaway_with_me
Reviews.Content: Small concert venues are the BEST! "Tears for Fears" on Sept. 12th could not have been better. Drew Davidsen was a bonus at Backstage Live the previous night. This place has some impressive names on their schedule! (Check it out.) We had a room/dinner/concert package. I would ask for a room facing the marina or the pool, as we were facing the parking lot where the tour buses run their engines a lot. Our room was clean and comfortable, no complaints there. Listening to Diana Ross play her set while lounging in the hot tub on our last night was an experience, although I wish it had been the Fixx instead... Maybe next year!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Roy_O_McClish
Reviews.Content: I had planned a stay-cation and Humphreys is the best spot ever. We felt as if we were back in Maui. The room had a wonderful view of the water and boats. The grounds were impeccable. The ducks were swaying to concert held that night, it was hilarious. We were both invigorated and happy tongo to work the next day. PS. We ordered room service and they gave us an estimated time without us asking. Then they showed up 3 minutes early. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Susiep143
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at Humphrey`s after a week in Las Vegas. It was just what we needed to wind down after all the hustle and bustle. Fab location on Shelter Island, with plenty of good restaurants in walking distance and at Humphrey`s, great views of the marina and the bay. Hotel grounds were very lush and green and beautifully tended. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Add to that the music either on stage by the Marina ( Tears for Fears & Diana Ross while we were there!) or in the backstage bar, where they have great bands everynight. The concerts are finished by 10 -10.30, so unless you want an early night, there is no problem. We were celebrating my husbands Birthday while we were there and also my 50th from back in May, which I mentioned when we booked and we had sparkling wine and a lovely card delivered to our room, which we thought was a perfect touch. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one”
Reviews.Author: simonabroad
Reviews.Content: Really nice location - just walk outside and you'll have a beatiful view at the San Diego Skyline. Nice, big rooms (well in fact it felt like you had your own little house there). For dinner either go to the restaurant or if you are fancy some music, just check the music place next to the restaurant.That's what I did - nice meal with entertainment... Next time in San Diego - Humphreys!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: Shandahbear
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at Humphrey's in early September. We reserved a Tropical View room that overlooked the pool area, and received one of the recently renovated rooms, which are super nice. The king-sized bed was quite comfortable with many pillows (always a plus for lounging!). We chose Shelter Island as we wanted the cool ocean breezes but not the beach crowds; the peacefulness of staying by the marina was wonderful. Many afternoons were spent lounging at the pristine pool area and in the evening, enjoying the jacuzzi. Days were spent journeying to Ocean Beach for fish tacos and sightseeing in other parts of town. All of the hotel staff we encountered were helpful; in fact, Humphrey's went above and beyond the call of duty when the power went out, and guests were provided complimentary sandwiches and refreshments by the pool. I look forward to visiting Humphrey's again. It may not be in Hawaii, but it sure has alot of Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Getting ready to head back to paradise!”
Reviews.Author: nuthatch12
Reviews.Content: Finally writing a long overdue review as we get ready to return! We had a lovely stay the week after Thanksgiving last year. Traveled with my husband and toddler. The front desk was so friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The hotel is located on San Diego Bay with an easy drive to the beaches, zoo, Balboa Park, and downtown/Gaslamp. Cabrillo Monument near the hotel is worth exploring, too. Our room was spacious; we chose the Grand Marina Suite for its full kitchen, room to play with our toddler, and separate bedroom to let him nap while we continued to enjoy the living areas. We really enjoyed our balcony with a beautiful view of the marina, just as you might picture a perfect San Diego view: water, sun, and boats. Peaceful and serene. Enjoyed showing our little guy the divers cleaning barnacles off the boats just below us. Had breakfast each morning in the restaurant; white tablecoths and a table at the window looking out on the marina. The servers always remembered our son's name and gave him lots of attention. We also had dinner there our first night (stayed 3 nights), and though we were nervous about taking our toddler into a fine dining restaurant in the evening, they were so welcoming that they put us and our son at ease, helped keep him content, and other guests actually came over to compliment us on our happy little guy. So glad we tried it; the food was delicious and they were extraordinarily accomodating of our modification requests due to our special diets. As everyone seems to agree, the grounds are gorgeous and we enjoyed our walk to breakfast each morning, stopping to see the macaws, little white duck, and koi on the way. We think it is really ideal for our family getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphreys Half Moon Inn September 5th for five days. From the moment we arrived the front staff was so friendly and helpful, and made us feel so welcome. We wanted to spend our anniversary in San Diego and after reading some reviews on line decided on Humphreys. We recieved an upgrade to a junior suite and the room was great. Had dinner at the restrauant on our anniversary and Tim the waiter was awsome. We will highly recommend Humphreys to all our friends and family. Mike and Romie Tucson, Arizona

Reviews.Title: “Smelly water was a turn-off!”
Reviews.Author: FaithsMom99
Reviews.Content: I don't know what was up with this place and its water supply but whoah did it stink!! Room was decent, nothing great, probably won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, Definately will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Jamie K
Reviews.Content: This hotel and it's staff are 5 star all the way. Friendly and relaxing atmosphere. Large, super clean rooms. When in San Diego, stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was just Ok.”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia R
Reviews.Content: This places wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great either. The water smelled like sulfur, so every time you washed your hands or showered, it smelled like you passed foul-smelling gas. The coffee pot in the room was prefilled with their water. Needless to say, we would not drink it. Other than that, it seemed clean and had all the basic amenities. There is a pretty harbor behind the buildings, but no path to walk around it.

Reviews.Title: “We hope to return and bring the rest of the family next time!”
Reviews.Author: sgh623152
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 6 nights at Humphreys and had a wonderful time. We really enjoyed the view from our first floor marina~view junior suite and enjoyed a morning walk every day on the bay walk just across the street. We were there during one concert night and there was a lot of activity but we were able to come and go as we wanted while being able to hear the band as it was playing ~ just a minor inconvience at best. The grounds are beautiful and the room could use a little updating but overall a wonderful lovely stay. The young ladies behind the desk were also very helpful and courteous during the entire time. We will hopefully return one day and bring the kids and their families to enjoy Humphreys and San Diego as well.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and close to Point Loma Nazarene University”
Reviews.Author: JamesPlihal
Reviews.Content: Humphrey's is a great place to relax. The rooms are clean, and the beds are comfortable. The pool is also very nice. The hotel sits right on the edge of the marina. My daughter and I stayed here when we were doing a college visit at nearby PLNU. We borrowed bikes from the resort and had fun riding around. Shelter Island is a nice area in San Diego. My only complaint was that there was quite a bit of airplane noise due to the hotel being north of Coronado Naval Station.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre views and rooms, and very loud during concerts”
Reviews.Author: NY_Theorem
Reviews.Content: Shelter island drive is a scenic location that offers a terrific view downtown San Diego and the bay. Unfortunately, Humphreys doesn't take advantage of the spectacular location--the rooms look on to either the parking lot or a decidedly unimpressive courtyard pool. Our courtyard facing room was reasonably spacious and clean, and featured a comfortable bed. Unfortunately, the shower head was mounted at about about 5'6", making showers awkward, the towels (cotton/polyester blend) had the consistency of high grit sandpaper, and whoever was tasked with collecting dishes/food from roomservice was derelict in their duties, leaving throughout the day and night a sad little bagel, open jelly containers, and dishes in the middle of the second floor deck that adjoined our room and the room of someone who had apparently enjoyed breakfast before we checked in. Not good. Unfortunately, my prior google searches also failed to turn up the fact that the Goo Goo dolls were playing at the nearby Humphreys venue on the night of our arrival. We turned up jet lagged and ready to crash early, and then discovered that sleeping or engaging in any activity other than listening to the Goo Goo dolls was totally impossible until the end of the concert, at around 11pm. It was insanely loud. I wish the Humphreys website had asterisked the concert nights on the calendar to give people a heads up. Definitely give them a call before making reservations--even if you like concerts, you might not like the band that's playing. If you're looking for a romantic place to stay, look elsewhere, but do visit shoreline park next door--the views are beautiful. On the other hand, if you're just looking for something basic with a pool and can get a good deal on a room (and know what you're getting into with respect to concerts), it might be a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Tiki-style motel/hotel, nice grounds, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gardog52
Reviews.Content: 60's tiki-style motel/hotel with updated and attractive rooms. Grounds were lush and the pool area was very nice; one wing of hotel faced the marina. Our room faced the parking lot which wasn't so great, but I got a last-minute internet deal at $99 so couldn't complain; although they do stick you with a $10 parking fee, and there aren't any other overnight options. No "resort fee", tho. Walls a bit thin, but not bad if you donâ€™t have party-hearty neighbors. The restaurant was very stylish and attractive with a reasonably priced menu (same as the neighboring restaurants). Lively happy hour at Backdoor Stage with 1/2 off drinks and appetizers. Only stayed one night, so didn't use the pool or eat in the restaurant. No concert that night at the outdoor concert venue, so I have no idea how that would have affected the stay. Great location on Shelter Island, which faces the S.D. inlet channel on one side and a large marina on the other. Other hotels and restaurants nearby. Not walking distance to harbor or Gaslamp areas - they are about a 5 mile drive along the Harbor Drive. But centrally located and short drive to these and most other areas, like Harbor/Gaslamp, Seaport Village, Mission Bay, Mission/Pacific/Ocean beached, zoo, etc. Hard to beat at that price considering location, summer in San Diego; would like to go back again for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds are beautiful”
Reviews.Author: eddiebill
Reviews.Content: We went for a dinner and a concert. Both were fantastic. The hotel was a different story. The first room that we were given was very dark and smelled musty. We were moved to another room which was better. Over the years we have stayed at this property on many occasions. It seems to be getting run down. It is not somewhere that we are planning on going back to any time soon. We stayed at an adjoining hotel last year which was much nicer. If you are going to Shelter Island stay at the Island Palms or Kona Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice but they do need to keep renovating”
Reviews.Author: arizonaac
Reviews.Content: My room was wonderful and had been updated. I have stayed here since 1981 and really love this place. Some rooms have not yet been updated and they do show their age but if you get one that has been updated you will really enjoy it. You cannot beat the setting on Shelter Island with the Marina behind the hotel, the concert series on the property in the summer and the wonderful walk down the waters edge to see the Navy base across the way and the might US Navy fleet coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, straight after our flight into LA. Thankfully the beds were comfy, pillows lovely. Everything was clean and smart. The location is good with lovely views of the downtown skyline. Be prepared to pay pricey parking rates though if you go into town for dinner. For breakfast there's a nice diner nice diner up the road with a good selection -cheaper than the hotel's breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mushuBelfast
Reviews.Content: I have been on vacation in San Diego about 8 times now, I have always stayed at Humphrey's Half Moon in Shelter Island. I really like the area it feels safe and relaxed and my family and I have become attached to Humphrey's. One of the highlights of our vacation is having breakfast in the mornings in their beautiful restaurant. There is a beautiful view looking out at the boats in the marina, the freshly cooked breakfast is top quality and the staff are very professional and friendly. This year there were no concerts taking place during our visit, but if I'm honest I would say I enjoyed it more without the concerts; less noise and less problems parking at nights. There is a very good outdoor pool, however it gets very busy. I really like the restaurants in the Shelter Island area, you can walk to some of them close by if you wish such as Miguel's and Fiddler's Green. I also enjoy the pizzas at Pizza Nova on Harbour Drive (about 1.5 miles away). Shelter Island is a good location, close to the airport, convenient for the zoo and Seaworld. This year we went for a drive around La Jolla and also played minature golf at Del Mar. Many thanks to Sheila for helping with my booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay..Special Concert Dinner, not so Special”
Reviews.Author: calconnect
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Humphrey's August 13th for the America Concert. We love this hotel, have stayed here before. The grounds are beautiful, perfectly maintained. The rooms are too!! All staff members are attentive and friendly. We booked a concert package, including dinner and a junior suite. The dinner in this package deal is priced at $65.00 per person. When you add cocktails and a bottle of wine on top of that...it's pricey! The dinner includes soup or salad, main course and dessert from a special concert menu. Good food, but not so special for the price. Could have , at least, tossed in a glass of wine?? If you price similar items on their regular dinner menu, the price would be in the $40.00 range. The concert venue is the best...1400 seats outdoors on the bay... WoW!

Reviews.Title: “Great concert venue, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelfreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphreys Half Moon in order to see America in concert. Their concert venue is GREAT! Small, intimate, but really good sound. The hotel has been remodeling, and it shows. the bed was comfortable, they gave an assortment of pillows (both firm and softer) and there were extra blankets and pillows in the closet (always a plus for me). The room was a bit small, but perfectly adequate for our short stay. I like the fact that they had a microwave and a small fridge- but the lack of a shop to purchase any thing to put in them was disappointing. We had not rented a car for our short stay and didn't have time to explore the nieighborhood looking for a grocery or convience store. The restruant was a bit to "fru-fru" for me. Our meal was included in the package, and the food was good, just not my style- I prefer simpler options. We are seriously looking at going again for the 3 Dog Night concert next month and will be waiting for next year's schedule to come out! Oh- and they have a free airport shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “Our own tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: fillupnsm
Reviews.Content: We discovered Humphreys after booking seats at the outside concert venue several years ago and have returned at least 2-3 times a year ever since. We have stayed in all categories of rooms and have liked them all. The rooms are spacious and clean most with views of the bay, the marina, the pool or the concert area! Going to a concert here is such an experience, especially as there are only about 1300 seats-- the atmosphere is amazing. The hotel staff are very friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a wonderful stay. Thank you Melissa, the Front Desk Manager and Sarah, the Internet Marketing Coordinator for taking such good care of us. We enjoy relaxing by the beautiful pool with a delicious drink served up by our favorite bartender Brittany, and wandering through the grounds which are excellently maintained. If you like you can check out a bicycle at the front desk to explore the island. At night, it's a great stroll by the bay and seeing the downtown skyline. There's a backstage lounge usually with live entertainment and a dance floor. The food in the restaurant is excellent, as well as room service which can be delivered to your room or poolside and ranges from a hot dog to a full three-course dinner with some healthy options also. It's hard to leave the hotel, but there's so much to see and do in San Diego, so a few days at Humphreys is just not enough.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was perfect for 5 of us--and updated!!”
Reviews.Author: LHH67
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we chose Humphreys bc we needed space for our family of 5. Read in reviews that although it was great, the suites were not updated like the regular rooms were. So, it was a very nice surprise when we walked in and our suite WAS updated! I guess they are in the process, as there was one little area in the kitchen that had not been rewallpapered yet. It did not bother us a bit. Everything was clean, new looking and beds were great! Room service menu could have been a little bigger, but as we only needed to use it once on our 4 night stay, it was not really a problem. We loved sitting out on our balcony while having a glass of wine, the boats were a great view to look at. I have to add that the high light of our trip was going to a little musical called MIXTAPE. It is an 80's show that was so much fun! Our group, from 11-70yrs LOVED it. If we return to San Diego, we will absolutely stay at Humphreys again. Trip Advisor is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Awful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SBtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Loud, small, dark and dank rooms. Uncomfortable mattress and scratchy sheets. Lots of hype but little comfort. A HUGE rip off! Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “awful beds, but great brunch!!”
Reviews.Author: lilsnipper
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our anniversary. we got a marina view room thinking we would get more bang for out buck. WRONG. great view, but outdated decor and the most uncomfortable bed ive ever slept on. dont stay here! the brunch the next morning was the highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Tiki Culture”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKlutch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights in a basic room at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn. We enjoyed it thoroughly and would highly recommend it for a relaxing vacation. The atmosphere is that of the "Tiki Culture" so popular in the 1950s and 60s. I could see how it would not be everyone's cup of tea. But I really enjoyed this and found it to be a refreshing alternative to modern, corporate hotel compounds. Humphrey's Half Moon Inn is located on Shelter Island which is a narrow spit of land jutting into San Diego Harbor. On one side of the island is a very large boat marina. On the other side is the harbor. Although our room faced the main road, there was minimal traffic during the day and almost none at night. We could also sometimes hear airliners across the harbor at the airport and an occasional Navy helicopter during the day. But this was far from bothersome and non-existent by bed time. Near the hotel are multiple restaurants within walking distance or a very short drive. We tried the Humphrey's restaurant for dinner on our first night. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend it. It was OK at best and overpriced for the food quality and quantity; and we used 25% off coupons provided by the front desk. Also, the decor is the proverbial, sterile, contemporary ensemble of gray, beige and chrome (yawn). Our table was right against a very large window which should have provided a spectacular view of the marina and lights of nearby Point Loma. Alas, the window glass is highly reflective and offers mostly muted, mirror images of the restaurant. I expect the views are quite nice during the day. In stark contrast, directly next to the restaurant is a club with nightly music. The jazz band playing there during our dinner was amazing and threw down well into the night. This place looks like a lot of fun. One of the best features of Humphrey's is the pool. It's much larger than I would have expected and sits inside the inn's lushly landscaped courtyard. Since it was built many years ago, it has a nine foot deep end. (Completely absent in modern hotel pools.) Although diving isn't technically allowed, consider yourself warned and have fun jumping into the deep end. Or, you can casually splash about in the larger shallow end. Directly next to the pool is a good-sized spa and a pool bar. Strangely, the pool bar shuts down early unless a concert is going on. I can only assume they prefer guests visit the night club or restaurant for drinks. Food is also available at the pool bar. Our room was not large, but was of adequate size and featured a good quality king bed with nice linens. The entire inn appears to be of post and beam construction with attractive wood features inside. The squeaky-clean bathroom fixtures were modern and of very high quality. Our room had no air conditioning; only a fan. We were a bit concerned about this initially, but soon learned the breezes off the bay keep Shelter Island beautifully pleasant during the day and downright cool at night; even in late July! My favorite part of our first-floor room was the small, semi-secluded patio. On one end of the room were three attractive wooden blinds stretching from floor-to-ceiling. Pushing these blinds to the side revealed a sliding glass door and an outdoor sitting area with a bamboo screen on one side and tropical plants on two sides. I thoroughly enjoyed reading on this patio in the absolutely spectacular weather of Shelter Island. Hint: if you too would like to read on the patio, bring a book light as there is no lighting in the area after dark. Every member of the Humphrey's staff we encountered was pleasant and polite. We purchased discount tickets to local attractions at the front desk which was very convenient. You can even check out a bike which is complementary for two hours. Be aware there is a $10.00 per day parking fee, but parking is quite scarce on Shelter Island.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, laid-back, somewhat retro and very unique”
Reviews.Author: zhdoerck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphreyâ€™s for a mini staycation, partly because weâ€™ve always wanted to stay there, but mostly to escape some long-term house guests for a night. My only complaint about Humphreyâ€™s is that I wish we could have stayed longer. Our stint was quite brief but long enough for us to enjoy the lovely harbor view and super comfy king-sized bead, tour the grounds, enjoy a leisurely breakfast, stroll around Shelter Island and meet Humphreyâ€™s resident free-range parrot. We thoroughly enjoyed the semi retro/semi Tiki vibe at the place and found the overall gestalt to be exactly what we were in the mood for. And the gardens were lovely. The one bit of advice I would give is to go elsewhere for breakfast and skip the on site restaurant. There was nothing wrong with it per se, but there are certainly better breakfasts to be had for the money (though the view and ambiance were quite nice). Oh, and FYI - the restaurant and room service close at 9 pm during the week, as does the Bali Hai restaurant down the street, so this is not where you want to be for a night cap or if youâ€™re a late diner. Aside from that, itâ€™s a great choice if youâ€™re looking for a unique San Diego experience on the moderately upscale side.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably rude security”
Reviews.Author: Zourzouvillys
Reviews.Content: After 3 years of pretty much non stop travelling and living in hotels about 8 months of the year, I felt compelled to write a review about the terrible customer service in this hotel. The couple we were travelling with had to stay in as one of them had severe pain in her side, and was bed ridden. We drove to get some food for her, and we dropped it off at her room at 12:50am. After talking for no more than 5 minutes, there was a knock at the door. I opened it, and was greeted with a very obnoxious security guard telling me in a condescending tone that he had walked past and heard us making noise (not sure what, other than asking how she was doing), and we needed to stop it. Being british, I did what every good englishman would do - apologized, and closed the door. The guys in the room were pretty shocked by the rudeness. As we left the room to head back to ours a few minutes later, I saw the security guy again.
