I told him "you might want to consider in the future to be more polite to your customers - nothing wrong with you asking us to keep the noise down if you thought we were making too much noise, but you were damn right rude to me". His response was angry, and pretty much shouting at me told me "you were rude to me first" ... which i'm a bit confused about as I opened the door and said "yes?". At this point I had enough, so continued walking back to our room. As we turned away to walk, he continued shouting at us.

Reviews.Title: “One of several stays, love going back”
Reviews.Author: grt_8woman
Reviews.Content: We found this wonderful hotel several years ago, and have been back many times. Not a typical high rise hotel, more of a nostalgic polynesian feel hotel/motel. Fantastic room service. Great views of harbor, easy location to all San Diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmerri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as a bit of a treat on our 4 week journey around California. We were not disappointed. We arrived early for check in, the receptionist informed us unforutnately she did not have the room we had booked available at the time so upgraded us to a tropical room! The room was absolutely beautiful, the sheets were soft. It was all very clean. We did struggle getting our 50lb suitcases up the slightly rickety steps but it was worth the climb. We spent the afternoon the pool which again was simply fantastic although we were a little confused by the minute towels! We dined in the restaurant in the evening. Fantastic views of the marina and the food was beautiful and not too extortionately priced. Service was excellent. Popped into the bar next door for a cocktail or two after. We ordered breakfast room service to dine by the pool the following morning - very luxurious and good food! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would defintiely go back if I was in San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “We are CRAZY about this place and don't want to stay anywhere else but Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: Razberry88
Reviews.Content: When we got to Shelter Island on Memorial day after a LONG drive mostly stuck in traffic around 9pm. We were exhausted and hungry and ready to unpack. When we got to the front desk it was absolutely beautiful and the customer service was great; they upgraded our room to a view of the lake and waved the fee. Many reviews state that this place is like Hawaii and I second that, there are so many tropical and colorful flowers, palm trees, and ducks waddling about everywhere. Its absolutely beautiful, my boyfriend and I felt like we were on a pre-honeymoon. The restaurants and stores were all in walking distance, but the restaurant at Humphrey's was the absolute BEST! We had the best breakfast with the most beautiful view of the boat harbor through the biggest window. Architecturally and decoratively Humphrey's is the BEST!!! There were always plenty of fresh towels, soap, shampoo and conditioner everyday and they take the time to make cute tissue flowers in the tissue box. We loved Humphrey's Half Moon Inn so much we ended up extending our vacation and staying an extra night rather than driving home after a long day at Sea World. We will DEFINITELY be back as SOON AS WE CAN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very tropical and fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rockinr
Reviews.Content: Went on vacation to San Diego with 4 teenagers. We had a blast! Humphreys Half Moon Inn was a great place to stay. We felt like we were vacationing somewhere exotic!! Plus it was very clean and comfy. The room was big enough to not feel crowded plus we could walk out to the pool from our patio. We went to the pool every night since it was heated. Can't say enough about it, convenient to Mission Bay, Sea World, Padres Game, Zoo etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: Robin747474
Reviews.Content: Very nice place although power went out when we were there, which I believe is a normal occurance. They were very nice about it, but it was hot. Pick a cool month to visit. Other than that, great place for families!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice!”
Reviews.Author: stefLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, and affordable for the price!! The pool area is awesome, the rooms (at least the one we stayed in) are updated so nice travertine / stone bathrooms, comfy beds, hardwood interior, very clean etc. Hotel is located near everything important in San Diego, and walking around Shelter Island itself was nice. Staff was helpful and cheerful - it was just a nice relaxing time!!

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel and san diego!”
Reviews.Author: andrewStainesUk
Reviews.Content: depsite having a pre-renovated room that was a bit dark we would return here in an instant. Lovely pool area with jacuzzi, sunbeds, 2 parrots that occupied the garden, and a small bar. However the girl didnt have a clue how to mix drinks. The staff were friendly especially in the restaurant where we had wonderful breakfasts overlooking the marina. We could walk to some great eating places and it wasnt far in the car to places we wanted to visit. The location on the waterfront was lovely with a nice view of downtown. Already planning to return next summer. We had a rate that included parking, i know some folks were unhappy about paying it.

Reviews.Title: “right place,right time,right price,right everything”
Reviews.Author: algernon007
Reviews.Content: reservation process very easy, made us feel confident that we would find what we intended when we got there. Booked through Sato travel for MCRD graduation, very satisfying. Only glitch was when we checked in there record showed we reserved four rooms instead of three. No problem, no discussion, they sucked it right up with out any questions or complaint. Rooms were very nice, quiet and opened onto the center courtyard looking like a Hawaii experience, beautiful. Used there shuttle service mercilessly, always good recommendations and information by drivers and in one case going beyond the call by dropping party of at a restaurant and taking one of us back to hotel to get a complimentary coupon and driving him back. Remarkable, in our experience. Will certainly go there again, close to everything and everything close to it!? Also, they have world class talent playing at a beautiful venue on the property.

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: llamadebbie
Reviews.Content: Just recommended by a friend we decided to go for it and venture into the unknown world of an unsearchable hotel...what a pleasant surprise.. First the room at the junior suite was tuck away in a sort of corner in the room, nice and dark for sleeping in with he bathroom located next to it for convenience...with a little balcony tat although face the street was amazingly quiet. The best were the beds...wow ! it was better than ANY other high priced hotel I have stayed and I have traveled all over the world. Clean and cozy, room service was quick and the food was still warm when delivered !!! The appointments in the room were much more than the price demanded and we loved the quality and abundance of towels. Staff was helpful and courteous. Our stay was so pleasant that we came back a week later and got a suite looking over the marina, again wow ! everything was detailed and the two balconies provided much room outside to bbq and the like. The kitchen however was a little lacking in some cooking essentials and more were requested and delivered, one thing , although the grounds are meticulous maintained the paint below the kitchen counter/bar was thin and peeling off from the wall, an unnatural sight on this sea of detailed attention. We are returning to say the least Jorge & Llama Mercade Twain Harte , Ca.

Reviews.Title: “First time in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: cstocker
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at Humphreys. My room was a little dated but very clean. It had a little kitchen and overall a spacious room. Also, it overlooked Humphreys' outdoor venue. During my first night stay, I was able to sit on my patio and enjoy Yanni in concert for free. It was a great show and it helped that my neighbor on the patio next to me was a cutie. :-) The staff at the front desk, restaurant, and hotel driver were super nice. The hotel is about 15 minutes away from downtown but there are some good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel offers free shuttle service to/from the airport. You must call them when you grab your bags to come pick you up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms/grounds, but poor insulation/sleep quality”
Reviews.Author: kseniacoffman
Reviews.Content: I came across the hotelâ€™s 48-hr 50% off sale as I was trying to make a last minute reservation for a conference downtown. The only other options were motels in sketchy parts of town, or $250+ downtown hotels. So $115 (50% off) was a great deal, even though itâ€™s somewhat out of the way ($25 cab ride to downtown). Shuttle driver was very friendly and pointed a few restaurants within walking distance from the hotel, which was helpful. I did follow his recommendation and had dinner at Umi Sushi â€“ it was very good. All other hotel staff were courteous and helpful. I had a Premier King (non-view) room on 2nd floor. The buildings look a bit weather beaten. The room itself was very nice, with vaulted ceilings, marble floors in the bathroom/kitchenette, plantation shutters, new furniture/fixtures. Coffee maker, mini-fridge & microwave are provided in the room, although no utensils/plates. Non-view rooms face out onto Shelter Island Drive / marina businesses. Traffic was light, so not bothersome. Grounds are very nice â€“ with a tropical vibe to it. (Although why pretend you are in Hawaii when you are in San Diego of all places?). I did not observe any loud parties during my mid-week stay; I saw mostly people with kids, retirees â€“ it was very quiet throughout the grounds. The real problem for me was poor insulation from inside/outside the room. I could hear my neighbors talking in the evening, people walking outside, work crew loading up hotelâ€™s construction materials at 11:30 pm outside, and again my neighbors either talking on the phone or watching TV starting at 5:30 am, or earlier (itâ€™s a blur now). If I were to pay the regular rate ($230 for a king room or even higher later in the summer), Iâ€™d rather stay in one of the newer bay front hotels downtown. Poor insulation/sleep quality was a deal breaker for me. In summary, your enjoyment of the hotel would depend on the rate you get; location of your room; and how loud/quiet your neighbors are. If I am ever to stay in this hotel again, Iâ€™m definitely bringing earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey Half Moon Inn & Suites is just greay”
Reviews.Author: 1keithw11
Reviews.Content: Sent to the General Manager: My crew and I have been campaigning a sailboat in San Diego for the last four years. What this means is from September to June, we are in San Diego for long weekends about once a month. Two years ago, at the recommendation of one of our competitors, we checked out and decided to move our program to Humphreys. I can tell you that we are extremely glad we did and will never look back. In the beginning we worked with Rachel and Melissa and now we work with Rhonda (Rhonda truly rocks!) and Melissa. All have been so accommodating, so great to work with, we could not be happier. All three have really gone out of their way to make us feel welcome and support us as plans change (Or maybe, I may have had it wrong in the first place) The impressive part about your organization is that it does not stop there. The team at the front desk is on it, makes us feel completely appreciated and welcome as we drag in off the late plane. While we are staying we have B-Fast in the restaurant, the staff always remembers us, makes us feel welcome, the service is just great and nothing is out of place. Over the last two years we have recommended your accommodations to many friends, family and competitors. All have stayed and all have been pleased. We will be back to San Diego for the Etchells World Championships in early June and while this is the â€œend goalâ€�, I am sure we will be back again. Your team is first class and congratulations. Keep up whatever you are doing! Please call me with any and all questions or I can provide any additional info, Keith

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Service...loved it.”
Reviews.Author: mcmug2002
Reviews.Content: Booked for $99/night including breakfast coupon ($10/pp for 2 adults) on Travelzoo. Includes free Wi-Fi in room. Parking was $10/day but that was reasonable compared to all the hotels in the area. hotel was near the Marina so great views and surroundings (no beach access though). The pool was very nice and they also have parrots/fish ponds/turtles in the garden....little things that kept our toddler entertained! We were staying on the 2nd floor and they don't have any elevators so you'll have to move luggage up the stairs...not a big deal for us as you can park right at the bottom of the stairs but some people might not like that. Great staff! very friendly and helpful. All in all a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the marina”
Reviews.Author: Sundae1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night at this hotel. Absolutely loved it from the location, to the staff and the little extras. There are some great little restaurants down the road and a great wine bar (with live entertainment) in the hotel. The pool was heated and it looked like we were in the tropics. The location, on the marina, is a bit different and lots of fun. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Humphreys Half Moon Inn - Charming Place to Relax in the City”
Reviews.Author: DAG83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphreys Half Moon Inn in September 2009 to celebrate my parents' 40th wedding anniversary. We booked two tropical suites, one of top of the other, with fabulous views of Shelter Island Marina. The suites are very large, although they could do with a refurbishment at the time of our visit the hotel rooms had been done with the suites due to be completed soon. The grounds and pool are beautiful and well maintained. The restaurant - worth positive reviews in it's own right - served an incredible champagne brunch on Sundays. The hotel's own outdoor concert venue was also an amazing addition - we saw LeAnn Rimes during our stay, who is one of my mother's favourite artists. The hotel is in a fantastic quiet location on Shelter Island, with the promende, pelican-and-sealion-filled harbour, and marina. The city is a short drive away, which offers fantastic views across the bay. While this is not a city-centre location and the buildings are not as well kep as some of the slick chain hotels, it is well worth staying here for the perfect combination of urban proximity and the quiet, easy-going harbour living. I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort-feels like somewhere in the islands!”
Reviews.Author: bco5012003
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite for for nights. My wide and I and our three kids, 14, 11, 8. The previous three nights we had stayed in a standard (but nice) hotel room, also in the San Diego area. It was so nice to spread our in this huge room. Kitchenette, dining room, living room, bathroom, bedroom...huge! Go the grounds are very lush, you feel like it's a small resort on maui maybe. Decent pool and hot tub area. Wonderful restaurant on the grounds. Easy access to everything San Diego had to offer, we did all the touristy things. By the way, if that is the reason for your trip, do yourself a big favor and purchase the Go San Diego Cars...you'll thank me. Overall, big rooms, very comfortable, especially for families. Very relaxing base of operations.

Reviews.Title: “I Should've Known Better....”
Reviews.Author: ronoliver
Reviews.Content: You'd think I'd know better by now, huh? In the six years The Boyfriend and I have been together, we have learned one lesson; if he plans things, they tend to be spectacularly successful. If I plan things, they tend to be disasters. I planned our anniversary stay at Humphreys. From the moment we arrived to find there was no porter to carry the bags from the car, to the discovery that there were 2 weddings and a convention going on in the place, things just went from bad to worse. The "junior suite" - the only option available when I booked over the telephone - was a grim, narrow room on the first floor just off the public entrance to "Humphrey's Concert Bowl". Furnished in what can only be described as Early Yard Sale, it featured a couple of hastily mounted flat screen TVs and a bed lumpier than your Aunt Bernice's lap. While advertised online as having a balcony overlooking the marina, this ghastly little cell instead boasted a view of the parking lot; the only way to actually SEE the Marina was to stand up and peer over the trucks and cars lined up directly beside our patio doors. I had arranged for an "artisanal cheese plate" to be delivered to the room as a surprise for My Beloved; we found it wrapped in cellophane and stuck in the back of the mini bar fridge. I'm hardly a cheese snob, but while a few slices of cheddar and a handful of walnuts might be considered "artistic" in some circles, we couldn't really enjoy it in any event, as there was neither cracker nor bread provided.... We returned to the Front Desk, hoping at the very least to move to a part of the hotel that didn't allow non-stop vehicle exhaust to billow in through the windows, but was informed by the pleasant and apologetic young lady that the place was sold out for the weekend and while we could move four doors along the hallway to a similar room, they had nothing else available. Price was not an object, I should note; I offered to pay an upgrade fee, but the place was full. To make amends, she offered us two free cocktails at the Bar. Now I will admit free booze can go a long way toward making me a happy boy, but in this case, when we finally found the Lounge/Restaurant (stuck in a flat, hideous box at the far end of the admittedly otherwise lovely Polynesian-themed property) the House Band From Hell was in full swing playing cover versions of songs that shouldn't have been written in the first place. Being a Saturday afternoon, the "joint was jumpin'" with pale out-of-towners scarfing down chicken wings and jugs of beer; while one is always pleased to see people having fun, the window rattling volume of the music wasn't conducive to the sort of romantic atmosphere we were hoping to find. We decided to try the Pool Bar but discovered it was closed because of the weddings and wasn't to reopen until the following Tuesday. Fortunately, a sweet young Bartendress took pity on us and provided two deliriously potent Mai Tais; these helped the pain considerably. I can't comment on the quality of the food or service at Humphreys, as the rest of the weekend was spent as far away from this gulag as possible, enjoying the various charms of San Diego about which I shall post on other pages - most of these were planned by The Aforementioned Boyfriend and were completely enjoyable. However, suffice it to say that while the hotel property itself is charming, with lush landscape and a reasonably sized pool heated to a comfortable temperature , one should beware of weddings, conventions and anything which bills itself as a "junior" something or other. And in future, I shall let The Boyfriend arrange EVERYTHING.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KRBresciano
Reviews.Content: I personally loved this place! My kids (4 and 7 years old) loved it as well. We had a suite with a kitchen in it, which was a must, so we were able to make meals in our room. There was no oven, but that wasn't a big deal. We mostly only had breakfast there. We did not eat in the restaurant, so I have no opinion one way or another on that. Some of the other guests I spoke with thought the decor and amenities to be a little out of date, but I didn't think so. Everything seemed well maintained. The grounds were well kept (though the Koi pond looked like it needed cleaning). I did do laundry there, I was unhappy with the results of that, but whether that was the result of the machines or the water itself I do not know. The service we recieved there was stellar. I had a package shipped (we were there for Easter - I sent my children's baskets) prior to our arrival with no problem. Any requests we made of housekeeping was taken care of in a timely fashion. I would recommend this place to family and friends, and if/when we return to San Diego, we will stay at Humphrey's

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great staff, wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: cpamom23
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an Easter weekend, post tax season getaway. It was terrific! We got in early and headed straight for the hotel to get settled....we were offered an upgraded room with a garden view for only $10 more per night - well worth it. The new room was not ready so we did some sightseeing - Humphrey's staff called our cell when it was ready. The room was beautiful - it had sliding louvered panels and a sliding door to the patio overlooking the lawn/garden area. There are beautiful plantings and fountains all over the property. The pool area is very nice and the hot tub was awesome! There is even a ping pong table.. request a room away from the pool if "kid noise" bothers you. The only things I can think of that would have improved the room are: a light in the closet hallway and some better arrangement for the coffee maker (I had to pull it all the way out of the shelving unit to fill it up with water) Oh, and more hangers (which were QUICKLY brought to us upon request) I can't say enough about the wonderful staff - especially Sheilah, who made our check out a breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Nice holiday style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Laconicsurf
Reviews.Content: A nice place to stay in San Diego. We booked a junior suite which was roomy and comfortable. Overall the place has a kind of package holiday hotel feel to it, the type you may find in Spain and Greece, though on a grander scale. The pool is great, plenty of room for everyone. A word to the wise, the hotel is also a music venue so you may have live music until quite late at night, great if you like the act, not so much if you don't and want an early night! It didn't bother me i have to say. Staff are friendly and welcoming. Overall, nice above average accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location, great staff, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: jmiertschin
Reviews.Content: Went here on a weekend get away with the wife. It looks like the place was recently renovated and I think they did a great job. Rooms were very clean. The place is very family-friendly although not overrun by screaming kids. The grounds are beautiful and full of tropical plants (even a couple of parrots). The pool and the hot tub are great. The bar and the restaurant have great views of the marina. Staff was very attentive and took care of all our needs quickly and with a smile. If you're staying here I also highly recommend eating a very nearby Italian place called Pomodoro. Doesn't look like much on the outside, but has excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Anniversary Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mscrysta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our "staycation" at Humphrey's and have only great things to say about this hotel and the staff! We live in San Diego and were looking for a good deal on an overnight package. We searched TONS of hotels and special deals but decided on Humphrey's because we had stayed there before and really enjoyed ourselves. This time around we bought a package deal that included a junior suite, breakfast for two, and two welcome drinks for $155 (after taxes, about $175). We feel our money was well spent as we got luxury accomodations in a beautiful atmosphere, GREAT food, and terrific service. The hotel even sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne to our room and never even charged us for parking (supposed to be an extra $10 per night)!!! The fancy plush robes provided to us in our room were an extra special treat- made us feel like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's Was Okay At Best...But Watch Out For Changing Rates!”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldAvalon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. The walls are very thin and we could CLEARLY hear everything the people next to us were saying in regular conversation. Luckily they were quiet at night. When we booked online the rate was 149 a night. TWO days later when we received our email confirmation the rates were 179 for one night and 159 for the other. We stayed on Wed and Thurs and the rate was HIGHER on Wed??!! Go figure. We asked the front desk why and they really had no definitive answer. Desk staff was not rude but were not particularly accommodating either. We traveled with a small child and the first room we had the mirror/glass on the closet door was not installed properly and could cut little fingers so we switched to another room where the top dresser drawer would not stay closed and was magically open everytime you turned around. We all kept walking into it so I don't really know which was more of a hazard, the closet door or the dresser drawer. The hotel was clean enough but not outstanding by any means and the mattress was terribly uncomfortable. The shining star of this hotel was their AWESOME and very large swimming pool, although the swimming pool and spa did attract a younger alcohol consuming and cigarette smoking crowd in the evenings, not too family friendly. Would I stay here again...probably not. I would rather take a chance on a different hotel mostly because of the switcheroo of the rates...I found that totall un-cool.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, relaxing...”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesKatkat
Reviews.Content: My stay was during the 1st week of April 2011 in their Premier King Room (non-suite). It was their basic unit but I loved it, was on the 2nd floor, facing the parking lot but the 2nd floor afforded a view of the harbor, though the parking lot trees did block the view a bit, but I was happy with that. The room was updated and reasonably well-appointed and had everything I needed. The in-room safe was large enough for my laptop, small fridge and microwave was perfect for my needs, the windows had been replaced and you can open the windows all the way, to allow fresh air circulation. The upgraded plantation shutters on the windows and closet were a very nice touch. The bed comfort level was so-so, though the linens and pillows were fine. They did a nice job in upgrading the units....not over the top and seemed not to have over-spent but did spend money in the right places. The mattress does need to be replaced at some point though. You could hear loud footsteps and doors banging when neighbors entered their units...but I was willing to put up with it as it was sporadic and of short duration. Bath/shower - got instant hot water, every time. As far as location, I loved it because I could take a nice 1 hour walk along the harbor and marina, everything (Sea World, Balboa Park, Convention Center, Chula Vista, Phil's BBQ, Sushi Ota, Old Town, Olive Tree Market, Cabrillo National Monument, Pacific Beach...were within 15 - 20 minutes), but Coronado Island ended up being about 30 minutes away....probably because I took Harbor to get there..maybe there's a faster way.) Parking was convenient (use your room card key), though it was $10 per day. High speed internet was included in the rooms with no hassle wi-fi connection. The restaurant next door was convenient and food was above average (only had breakfast). The tropical garden was very nice to relax in. I would stay here again, as I would avoid the convention area, downtown and gas lamp area like the plague due to their congestion and touristy-atmosphere. I prefer Shelter Island as it's quiet, relaxing, right next to the water, a very clean area, and felt safe. I avoided staying on Harbor Island as it seemed too close to the airport and I wondered about the air plane traffic and noise. My only disappoint was the General Manager, Sergio. He was a bit cold, aloof and quite frankly, a real departure from what is expected of the gracious attributes typically exhibited by professionals in the hospitality business. I was also a bit turned off housekeeping and maintenance staff's attitude towards conservation. On at least three separate occasions, I found multiple light switches and the AC fan switches in the ON position, after they left the room. Also, the air filter was filthy and was easily visible as the air filter cover was hanging wide open until brought to the attention of management.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, Fabulous Restaurant, Wonderful Location, Excellent Staff, everything Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: OldTravelinPaps
Reviews.Content: I usually won't give an excellent rating. I pay my hard earned money and I expect them to provide a quality room and above average service. But, they treated me like I was about to determine their next raise. I traveled with my Wife, Mother-in-Law and my Sister-in-law. We stayed for 10 days and we didn't have one complaint. We did have a few special requests and the staff was always friendly and accommodating. The Restaurant was GREAT!!! My Wife started her career working for a gourmet chef and spent many years in that field. She's very "picky" about food and service, even she was raving about the meals (the Sunday Brunch is magnificent). If you knew me, you'd know I spent years traveling for a living. A clean room, a good bed, an updated hotel and a friendly, competent staff is the minimum a Hotel should provide. These things just make you average. The Half Moon Inn was truly exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Sensational, Beautiful Property~ Outstanding, personalized service, dining, and luxury suites!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSiren
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by the disappointed guests' reviews. Clearly, they have not experienced the sprawling, gorgeous, beautiful Marina View Suites, which are very reasonably priced. In my experience, if you book the cheapest room on the property, you get what you pay for. I average 44+ nights a year in hotels, so suggest paying a little more for a room that you will be happy with. It is a good idea to inquire directly with the hotel staff so they can accommodate your wishes, and suggest a room, or suite that you would be more comfortable in. The grounds, pool area, and restaurants are pristine, and quite lovely. Service is impeccable. I love this property! I am a Hilton Hhonors Diamond VIP, and travel frequently, and always choose this fabulous independent property on Shelter Island, when visiting San Diego. The GM, Sergio Davies, is wonderful~ Management sets the tone and it certainly shows as I have stayed at Humphrey's 4 times in the past year, and have never had one complaint. The management of this property is extraordinary, and precise. The room service, in-suite dining, and restaurant have been exceptional. The hotel staff is warm, friendly, helpful, and go out of their way to ensure your stay exceeds your expectations. This hotel is extraordinary on all levels. Five Stars!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star stay the first time, this time very different”
Reviews.Author: CorinneRT
Reviews.Content: I feel terrible writing a bad review over a hotel that I love so much. My first visit to the property was December 2010 and Mr. Wonderful and I fell in love with the hotel. We had a great room and great customer service. Even when the sink sprung a leak they sent someone right away to fix the problem. I signed up for email notifications for the hotel and received a promotional email that we decided to take advantage of. The package included a great rate, free parking, bike rental and 2 for 1 dining vocher. When we arrived to the hotel to check in, it was a different story. In short, we argued with the front desk staff who stated this was not the package we booked and refused to honor their advertised rate/package. The staff was terribly rude. It was my own fault for not printing out the confirmation confirming these added perks (I did not think it would be an issue at check-in). Now I am sitting here typing looking at the print out which I didn't have with me at the time that states the free things we should receive but never did. I checked my bank statement today to show that I had been charged for parking when I shouldn't have. I called the hotel once again to get the refund which they still refused. The hotel would rather argue over $20 and lose a customer for life. We visit San Diego 4 times a year and would have brought great business. Aside from that, the hotel is beautiful, and the grounds are well kept. Just please learn from my mistake and if you book a package deal where you are supposed to get stuff included, bring the proof!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: CMLinDaytonaBeach
Reviews.Content: Have been here several times - love it. The restaurant service is slow but food was good. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “A celebration in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: LeesaQT
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time celebrating a couple special birthdays for my husband and a friend. Our suite was the perfect location for the birthday surprise and allowed us to enjoy a weekend of sun, beach walks, afternoons at the pool and dancing in the lounge to great live music. The hotel, staff and atmosphere were all amazing, if you want to enjoy the best of San Diego this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Vegasbrad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with Humphreys more than once, and each time it's a great experience. The location, staff, amenities - everything is as it should be. Parking is an occasional issue, but this is to be expected at any bayside location such as this. The concerns other people bring up are pretty ridiculous. Humphreys is a quaint, bayside lodge with modern amenities. Parking is at a premium due to it's fantastic location. It's been around a long time and the professionalism of the staff proves it. If you want a new hotel with untrained employees and plenty of parking, this is not the place for you. If, however, it is more important that you get a beautiful view, gorgeous surroundings and exceptional service than it is for you to get a good parking space or that "new" smell in the hallways, then look no further. I stay here every chance I get, and I have never been anything other than 100% satisfied in every way. I would highly recommend it to anyone with a realistic expectation of what it means to stay in a classic waterside inn in the heart of the most beautiful city on earth.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel with some nice upgrades”
Reviews.Author: briarthyme
Reviews.Content: its on the bay, the tropical landscaping is lush and beautiful, it has a quiet and clean, but older, dated exterior. and the hallway to our room was a little too dark. they have an outdoor music in certain times of the year. the hotel employees were helpful and friendly. the pool area was extremely nice. you can walk along the bay, fish off a dock--we saw a man fishing pull out a baby octopus one evening. lots of good eateries close by. inside the room--its large with 2 flat screens-one is the bed area and the other in the living area, it had a wall safe, a mini kitchen with fridge, sink, micro, coffee pot. updated bathroom. there were sliders that opened to a beautifully garden and the two quiet hotel pets (parrots) entertained us during the day. below them was a koi pond. the room could have been cleaner--better attention to details--the air ducts were beyond dirty, there were some cob webs, but most everything else looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like I was in the tropics!”
Reviews.Author: Mom4Loves2Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family of six and enjoyed everything about this property. The suites are spacious and clean! We liked the tropical feel, especially around the pool area. Would recommend and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: LongBeachJack
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a nice hotel, but it was more like a nice motel. Rooms - We had a SMALL room on the first floor with no windows. The door was a sliding glass door that gave a view of the walkway and retaining wall. Since there was a lot of foot traffic in front of our room, we kept the curtains closed on our sliding glass door. Parking - The parking lot was full and though we found a space, we had to walk quite a bit to get to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveO220
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and found the room was simple but comfortable. Because it's in a popular location by the bay, there is some noise, but not excessive the night we were there. They have a wonderful looking music venue and I understand they have some great shows. They had a well known band in the bar (for those over 50!), Savoy Brown, the night we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suite - Perfect for families & good price”
Reviews.Author: Arilisanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large Marina Suite and were NOT disappointed - the rooms were perfect. We were able to sleep the babies in the bedroom and stay out on the sofa bed, which I'll admit was not all that comfy, but it was a sofa bed- had we stayed in the bedroom with the little ones, the beds in there were quite comfortable. It was very spacious - great for hanging out with the whole family. The breakfast from the restaurant was fantastic. Parking could sometimes be tricky as the lot was sometimes full and we had to walk a bit. But very few complaints about this place - I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Riff M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful Valentine retreat at this hotel. We enjoyed the lush tropical setting with its palm trees and parrots! The pool is long enough to actually swim and the large hottub is very inviting! The hotel is set around the pool with San Diego Bay across the street and the yacht harbor behind it. We had a junior suite with 2 flat screen tvs,great shower,coffeemaker,fridge,and microwave. They have room service, a wonderful happy hour in the bar/lounge with music and half price food. We also had a fabulous dinner in their fine dining restaurant. I got a groupon for $30 worth $60!!YUM! Before dinner we took a walk along the bayfront to watch the sunset and downtown all lit up at night. One of the Holland America cruise ships was departing and it was a beautiful sight. My 2 complaints are that the towels at the pool are teensy and thin AND that the TV had boring channels. Those 2 things will NOT stop me from returning. I hope to go back in the summer when the concerts are on at their music venue.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for my tastes!”
Reviews.Author: tpatts
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, mainly because it isn't like a hotel! The apartment-style rooms are 'south sea island' style, with a pool in the centre and a marina on one side, with palm trees all around (we preferred the Marina Suites). Shelter Island is an ideal base for visiting San Diego, convenient to the airport, the city and the beaches (hire a car). There is also a concert venue which is active in the Autumn. The staff were very friendly and helpful - we'll be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort!”
Reviews.Author: SnowboundMN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights in a beautifully decorated king room overlooking the pool. The room had a comfortable bed, a huge television, and all the amenities we needed. We actually had the pool and hot tub all to ourselves on the first night! Happy hour at the restaurant was a nice treat too. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Business & Leisure... Though Not Relaxing... at ALL!!! A Few SImple Changes and it Could have been great!”
Reviews.Author: Travelguru38
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say we have a WONDERFUL STAY! Pillow top beds turned over because they are so old, uncomfortable beds, old hard pillows, sheets too worn to fit the beds, smelly rooms, helicopters going around the hotel all hours of the day and night, dirty, dusty rooms, VERY VERY VERY thin walls ( you hear EVERYTHING literally) broken light fixtures, jack hammers and construction both on the grounds and on the sidewalk in front of the rooms. Room was a downgrade of the one we ordered, because the one we reserved was under renovation?! Bike rentals quoted as available throughout our stay were not available throughout our stay. Large in room parties both upstairs and next door both Fri and Sat or our stay. HOnestly if you are looking for a stress vacation. Perfect! We booked under travelzoo for $85 a night and they charged us $95 and $105. This place is awful. Oh top it all off.... we were told to go to happy hour. waited 40 minutes to get waited on... and were told we had to hurry up and eat because the music was starting early tonight and when we left. The hostess yelled at us for still being in the now lounge! Every time we called the guest services and bell desk they were rude and unhelpful. Oh their washer literally ripped several of our clothes to shreds and the front desk said .....nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Only a few more tweaks would have made it a great stay....”
Reviews.Author: miselainis
Reviews.Content: Yes, Humphrey's is old, but they had done quite a bit to update the bathrooms and other fixtures. The grounds are gorgeous and tropical. The restaurant food was delicious. I also loved the area. I was central to so many things I wanted to do-- research at the library downtown, shopping nearby, a close drive to the Coronado bridge for a visit to the Hotel del Coronado, and Ocean Beach for some antiquing. I was here for loads of genealogical research, so was usually gone all day, and wanted to enjoy the room at night. Problem was that certain things that SHOULD have been updated have not. Problem #1- During the day, my room was nice, with a sliding glass door and nice patio onto the tropical courtyard. Wooden louvered shutters slid over the glass doors, providing adequate privacy, so that was good. But at night, it was TOO DARK!! There was only a small desk lamp and a small bedside table lamp. Because the ceilings are wooden-beamed, I assume that overhead fixtures might be a fire hazard. BUT they need some extra floor lamps or something. It is just too dark to be able to do much. And I needed to work on my computer at night to plan what I needed to research the next day. #2- There are VERY FEW outlets in the room. My main problem was that I wanted to be able to research on my computer while watching TV at night. There is ONE outlet along that wall. Meaning TV and computer, or lamp and computer, or lamp and TV. Not all three. With so little light in the room already, I couldn't think about not turning on the lamp at all. So I finally had to set my desk lamp on the nearby occasional chair. #3- I believe one other reviewer mentioned it too. The cable channel selection SUCKS. Out of about maybe 20 channels, you get THREE sports channels, one of which is all Padres. And Fox News. Yay. I was really looking forward to checking out the season premier of White Collar on USA, but they don't get it. Without TNT and the occasional Law and Order there, or a few shows on the Discovery channel, I would have just kept the stupid thing off. There are some really great things about Humphrey's. If they upgraded their cable and got a few more lights in the rooms, I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise in the City”
Reviews.Author: spalover30
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego for the MLK weekend and got this hotel on a Travelzoo special discounted rate. I was blown away by the tropical grounds and the resort feel. We got a bargain at $100 per night for the newly remodeled room. The pool area is really welcoming. The view from our room was lush and green. The staff was always friendly. The location is about a fifteen minute ride into the downtown area. A cab ride to the Gaslamp quarter was about $15-$20. I'd say the location is a bit remote but totally workable if you get a bargain price as we did. The Humphreys Live bar/grill always has live entertainment nightly. The happy hour specials are priced really low. However, don't go there expecting to be in and out as service was very slow. If you're in no rush go there for the h-hour and enjoy the music. We had five plates of food, two drafts, and a glass of nice wine and the total was only about $35 with tax and tip. It is very quiet and peaceful on the grounds. You get a good night's sleep. Our travel deal said use of the bikes for free but there are only two bikes available and they were checked out. It would be good if the hotel got some more. Very pleasant stay. Again, just realize you're a bit off the beaten path there and prepare to travel back and forth to the "city". Overall-loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: abakerDowney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the ground floor tropical view room with a patio. It was very relaxing and in the "Hawaiian Theme". I was very impressed with Shelter Island, quaint and very friendly. The other choice was the marina view which on my next visit I will most definately try. It too had an amazing view of the marina and patios on ground floor and balconies on 2nd. floor. The staff were friendly and very accomodating. We loved our stay here and would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Make this your play to stay in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: holsgig26
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel from the moment we stepped in the lobby! We felt like we were in Hawaii.Our room was beautiful! Not your typical hotel room. It had a huge flat screen TV, wood beamed ceilings, plantation shutters, amongst other great perks! The king bed was awesome, pillow top mattress with an actual down comforter! The closet was huge, bigger then mine at home.The is a coffee maker, refrigerator and microwave on the way to the bathroom, around a corner. The pool was beautiful and huge! We ate lunch and dinner in the bar, lounge on site. Happy hour all meals and drinks are half off. And believe me it was awesome. There was also a band playing and since we were staying at the hotel there wasn't a cover charge. The view at the restaurant overlooks the marina and is breathtaking. if you choose to here, you will love it. Plus, if your taking a cruise like we were you can leave your car here for the entire time, no charge! Awesome deal all around!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of funky--with a lot of charm!”
Reviews.Author: Petite1Redding
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town with our adult son, his wife and two preschool children. Our suite had to have been around 1,000 square feet which included a living room, kitchen, dining area, large changing area, nice sized bathroom and a bedroom. We also had two patio areas and lawn area. When we return to San Diego we plan on staying here again & telling our business associates, as well. Our suite would have easily accommodated 8 people. With the adjoining lock-off room, it could have been 12 and offered an additional bathroom. The dining table was huge and could easily seat a large family. The only thing missing in the kitchen was an oven. Thanks for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Even nicer than expected at the half moon”
Reviews.Author: Needhamites
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our last night on a trip ending up in San Diego. Grounds are beautiful with lush palms lining the walkways. Pool is huge and heaten, and hot tub was large and hot. Rooms were even nicer than I expected, with nice furniture, granite bathrooms, and two 42" TVs. Internet is free which many hotels leave out. Saturday brunch at the restaurant was well priced, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and had a very mixed experience. My first contact with the hotel was extremely negative. I made hotel reservations in late November. I then kept track of the web site to see if there was a New Year's Eve party we could attend since we were staying at the hotel. They did not have reservations for the party available on Open Table. Finally, I noticed that there was a New Year's Eve party advertised on the web site, so I called the hotel and was told that I couldn't reserve over the phone (even with a credit card) but that they would have to either fax or mail (no e-mail) a form for me to fill out and fax or mail back. Are you kidding me???? I gave the employee my address to mail me the form, and then she put me on hold for 8 minutes -- why? Finally, I hung up and they never mailed me the form so we didn't get to go to the New Year's Eve party, even though we were staying at the hotel. When we got to the hotel we asked the receptionist if there were any reservations for the party available as a staff member had told us there were, and she was quite abrupt and curt and told us we had been misinformed and that there were no reservations available. No apology, no attempt to help us find something else, just a very snotty no. That's okay, we went across the street to Bali Hai, which happily accepted our Open Table reservations and we probably had a better time there anyway. Apart from those two staff people, the other staff members were fine and did a good job. The hotel grounds and room were quite lovely and the bar and restaurant were great-the Happy Hour prices are not to be believed. It is also a nice touch that they let you use bicycles for free two hours per day. Throughout the stay, my husband and I were debating whether or not we would stay again and I think we've come down on the side of yes, but more customer service training by certain of the staff would not go amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was Dirty, Dated, Dark and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: worldtrav2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the oversized garden view suite. The room was a very good size with two 42 inch LCD TV's, a kitchen (albeit with dirty utensils) and comfortable sofa bed. Good points were the room facilities - it had just about everything including large refridgerator, toaster and microwave as well as a stove. Lots of HD TV channels available too. It is clear that the hotel had upgraded certain aspects of the room like the bedding and TV's, but the room remained in poor condition with a hole in the ceiling and a myriad of un-dusted surfaces everywhere, together with mold in the bathroom and a noticeable lack of any decent lighting. Whilst the hotels upgraded rooms may be nice, the suites certainly aren't! Many words come to mind including dark, dated, dingy and dirty. Add this to the noise from the "low grade" guests this place seems to attract and the thin walls allowing us to hear the guy next door shouting in the middle of the night and you get the picture that WE WON'T BE GOING BACK ANYTIME SOON. Not that the hotel seemed to care as they never asked us how our stay was! My advice is to book the Bay Club Hotel and Marina next door instead. It has half price parking at $5 a night compared to the $10 fee at Humphreys, much cleaner rooms and a free breakfast to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Indeed”
Reviews.Author: Fellowbot
Reviews.Content: You want to stay here. I'm not one to write reviews, but this is the rare exception. The location is far enough away to be quiet and close enough to get to everything. The hotel is surrounded by the ocean and great restaurants. The rooms are a nice size, comfy and clean. The pool is the centerpiece of the hotel so bring your suit. No doubt we will stay here on our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: care1784
Reviews.Content: While this location is a favorite for a winter business meeting, this location is NOT my favorite destination. The hotel does not have any business amenities apart from whatever is offered during the meeting. You are not allowed to print more than three pages from their computer. I offered to pay any additional costs and was denied. The front desk attendant offered to print something from their computer if I e-mailed it to her, which unfortunately was not an option. She also denied me from logging onto the portal on that computer from which I (or she) could then print. To make a bad situation worse, she was NOT pleasant to deal with. I think that it is absolutely ridiculous that a hotel hosting business travelers does not have an appropriate means to print, even for a cost. Based on their inability to accommodate a seemingly simple request, I certainly would not want to be staying here for a leisurely vacation either. The hotel is loud and the rooms are not that great. It is a spectacular location and accommodating during conference hours, but that is all that it has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Resort feel in a city...pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: want2travelm0re
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Humphreys for our Anniversary for 3 nights the first week in December 2010. We booked through the hotel website and got a package deal that included a rental car (enterprise delivered and picked up car from hotel with ease). We were very happy with everything during our stay. Our rooms was spacious and updated with a great view to the pool area. The grounds of the hotel were absolutely beautiful, we felt as if we were at a resort in the city. We always felt safe as well. Parking was easy, restaurant was great - but pricy. The hotel bar had live music nightly ($10+ per person depending on the entertainment) and the outdoor venue was quite large (closed for the season). There is a free shuttle to the airport as well. Shelter Island is located very close to everything in San Diego and has an amazing view of downtown. We had a fabulous time on our trip to San Diego and our stay at Humphreys, we will go back again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissiCAD
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego for a conference and built in a few extra days to see the area & enjoy ourselves. We spent our vacation part of the trip at Humphreys Half Moon Inn. What we saw of the staff was very friendly. We were gone almost all day sightseeing so we didn't see a lot of staff, but our room was always cleaned, towels replaced, and the staff we did see was friendly & helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The air conditioner was a little louder than most, but not loud enough to bother us. The view from our room was great, and Shelter Island is a beautiful setting. The hotel was very quiet, we didn't hear any other people around us even though there seemed to be plenty of cars in the parking lot. We got a package that included tickets to the zoo which we really enjoyed. The price for the room with the zoo tickets were very reasonable. Cheaper than a lot of what I saw that had views of the water & and a great deal for the price. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, excellent location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: unols
Reviews.Content: We have used Humphreys for conferences for years. Their services have been repeatedly top notch. Our participants come from around the country and they are particularly helpful with transportation issues. The food service is excellent. The catering staff is outstanding. Any requests are made are taken care of in a very timely fashion. We will continue to hald conferences there whenever we meet in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite of all the California hotels we stayed in on a 2 week trip.”
Reviews.Author: bentotata
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, backing onto a scenic marina that seems to stretch on to miles. The main restaurant serves a delicious breakfast, and the dinner was quite good, too (prices are a bit above what you'd normally expect in a 3-star, but then again so is the calibre of the hotel). The room itself was lovely, not overly spacious but very welcoming, with beautiful wood ceilings and a very nicely done bathroom. The gardens and pool area were beautiful, superior to those of similar hotels in the area. The price was great. We paid $90 a night for 2 nights. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!! YOU HAVE TO STAY @ HUMPHREYS”
Reviews.Author: HotSpotzloverz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at Humphreys for a Bridal/Bachelorette Party with about 7 of our close family and friends, Humphreys is truly unimaginable until you really get their the pictures on their web site seems too good to be real!! But.... it is breathtaking. The Scenic view is amazing all of are pictures just came out so great we all started to cry!! We loved are stay so much we came back to Humphreys to get ready for my mothers wedding, we stayed in the Marina View Suits! Also a very big plus you do get what you pay for, extraordinary Customer Service, the Pool & spa, even the food & drinks,spacius rooms, the beds are so comfy & yes the VIEW!! Thanks for everything Humphreys....we will be back soon for another stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lawa306
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for a wedding last weekend and had a great experience. The only caveat is that we stayed in a renovated room- I think there are other rooms on the property that are not renovated and I don't know if they are that nice- but, the renovated room we had was very trendy and comfortable. We asked for a pack and play for our baby to sleep in at night, and it fit fine into the king room- we still had room for the stroller and our suitcases. There were big screen TVs and comfortable beds with nice linens etc.. It was really a comfortable hotel. The only downside is that it is very close to the airport- Point Loma is anyway, so we could hear a lot of planes taking off and landing which was louder than I expected, but not bad. Also the area is a tad industrial/shipping, but there are cute places to walk to for breakfast. We had breakfast once in the hotel which was very good and also went to the bar. Overall a great hotel and I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: nick1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the half moon inn back in May when the renovations were still being carried out. I requested a renovated room at check in but unfortunately they were fully booked (due to the black crows playing the next night) but they upgraded us to a concert view room FOC. The room was really nice and clean even though it was an unrenovated room!! and it was amazing to look out the window and watch the show for free!!. Parking was easy (does get busy on show nights though) and the location of the hotel was excellent (10 min drive to downtown San Diego). The best thing about this hotel though was the general ambience. The staff were very helpful and the whole place had an almost tropic feel. Would definitely go back and would love to see a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and grounds”
Reviews.Author: sandit10
Reviews.Content: After looking this up on Tripadvisor and finding it had a free airport shuttle, decided would like to stay there the first day of our business trip. So glad we did. I preferred this hotel to the Sheraton which was our paid stay. The bathrooms were nicer and newer and the rooms had a usable fridge and microwave. Loved the patio off our room that looked into the lush gardens. We loved being close to the beach walk as well. Would have loved to have been there for the concert the day we left San Diego. I must say though the breakfast @ their restaurant was great. Lunch was a disappointment. The service and the view and lovliness of the restaurant helped that the sea food we ordered was very poorly done. The shuttle service was excellent and even shuttled us to the Sheraton the next day. The only down side is you would have to take a bus to get to the rapid transit. It would have been very nice to have been shuttled to the trolley system.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time”
Reviews.Author: TerriHB
Reviews.Content: My husband and some dear friends stayed at Humphrey's exressly to see the Jackson Browne concert. I can't enough wonderful things about this hotel and the concert venue. It was just an awesome time. The staff was wonderful, especially Dawn Sanders. We will be back again, and promise to bring an even larger crowd and stay longer to enough the beautiful San Diego weather. Oh, yeah, the Jackson Browne concert was pretty great, also.

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk staff and nice newer rooms”
Reviews.Author: nutplus
Reviews.Content: Again my friends and I had a great stay here. Kristina at the front desk was very helpful and professional with reservations and letting us know if there were upgrades available. The gardens and rooms were very well kept and made us feel like we were "really" on vacation! Thanks to all the staff that made this another wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Warning!”
Reviews.Author: bbb053
Reviews.Content: Beautiful venue to hold an event but not worth the hassle they put you through!! Had a wedding hosted here and service was awful, security was the worst we've ever dealt with, room service was ridiculously slow, staff was not accomodating. Find somewhere else to invest your money!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: airsupplygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because we had tickets for a concert on 09/11/10; my favorite band "Air Supply" played that night; great outdoor venue for concerts; our concert package included dinner at their restaurant, front row tickets and a beatiful marine view suite (over 700sq ft); just beutiful! I can't stop thinking about that room, we even had 2 beds in our toom, the bedroom was huge and we had large flat screens in the bedroom and the living room; we also had a beautiful balcony with the perfect marine view from the second floor. We arrived very early as usual and they gave us the marine view room(we were originally booked with our Lexus Premius package for the Garden View); no complaints here I loved our room. I'm trying to convince my boyfriend to go back to this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Ckosh
Reviews.Content: Being a San Diego Native that no longer lives in San Diego I wanted my trip to "back home" to give me everything San Diego has to offer. This hotel and Location does just that. This was combo family vacation/anniversary celebration. We arrived to our garden view room and waiting for us was a bottle of champagne and chocolates...what a great surprise....The grounds were beautiful and view was spectacular any where you walk on the grounds there is some lovely to look at. We had an upgraded room and was very satisfied with it, and according to other review was a good thing to do. We were close to everything Shelter Island is one the best places in San Diego, but there are so many to choose from. Close to everything. The only complaint that I have was that our "garden view" was of a brick wall. The garden was above the wall. Other than that it was great. Will defiantly stay there the next time we go to San Diego!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't have a Reception / Group event here!”
Reviews.Author: kmcginnis
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a family desitnation wedding. Service was horrible -- checkin slow; was told there was not a room available on lower level, yet when my sister checked in 10 minutes later, she had a choice of available rooms (same bed options). Pool bar not open on a Friday -- had to walk to the lounge to purchase drinks. Many lounge chairs at pool had rips, if you sat on them, you'd fall right through! Service at the restaurant was very slow as well -- heard same feedback from others for various times/days going to the restaurant. Reception was reserved in their Ballroom until 11:30 pm; at 10:30 pm security came to room to say there was too much noise, reception would have to end at 11 pm! Only 100 people with DJ - no live band. Nothing out of the ordinary as far as a reception goes! Bride's parents had guests back to their SUITE after the reception to continue festivities, Security brought the police to dispurse -- because one guest complained about noise! However guest across the (outdoor) hall didn't even hear any noise! Apparently Humphrey's is a hotel for rest and relaxation only -- in your rooms with doors and windows closed before 11 pm or Security may be giving you a warning! While they were on top of noise security, other security was lacking. Our room was left open while the maid was cleaning and our son (adult) was able to enter and take items from the room without the maid even noticing he had been in the room! Guess anyone could have gone in and taken anything they wanted undetected! How can a hotel cater to wedding receptions, then try to shut down a reception at their facility?! No one received notifications regarding noise curfew times at checkin, nor are there any signs indicating such a curfew, yet the security tried making an issue of no noise after 10 pm! On the positive side, the room was nice, clean and comfortable. The food took long to get, but it was good.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT host your wedding here!”
Reviews.Author: Kikijeter
Reviews.Content: Do not, do not, DO NOT get married here it was a NIGHTMARE! The worst part - security told us he was going to "shut down" the reception and hour and a half early because we were being "too loud!" We wanted room service for all of the girls on the morning of the wedding and it took 2 hours to get it with no apologies and multiple phone calls. My in-laws booked their largest suite to use as a hospitality suite for all the guests to eat and drink at, and every night security came by to tell us to be quiet. When asked if there had been complaints they said, "no, we are just be pre-emptive." It even got to the point that the one security guy called the cops and had 8 (thats right 8!) cops come to "break-up" our party as well as three other wedding party get-togethers. They told family member who were from out of town to be quiet in their OWN rooms through the screen door during the day. This place was absolutely ridiculous and I HIGHLY recommend that NO ONE use this resort. They hold concerts and weddings all the time yet we seemed to be the loudest party to ever step foot on that resort. Save your money and go to a place where they will accommodate you and your guests! I feel terrible for my in-laws who were embarrassed by all of the issues we encountered, especially since in was a destination wedding and everyone came from out of town!

Reviews.Title: “Can't WAIT to go back...”
Reviews.Author: HRBurdette
Reviews.Content: I had a sort of "Disney's Polynesian Village Hotel" image in mind when I first booked this spot, and from the exterior, I wasn't disappointed. It is a little kitschy, but in that cool sort of way if you're open to that--and I am. But the ROOM! Absolutely lovely. Based on the other reviews I've read, I'd guess we had one of the remodeled ones, and it was very nicely-appointed. Totally contemporary furnishings, a snuggly blanket laid out on the bed, a big flat-screen TV, convenient fridge, microwave, and of course, coffee maker. The beautiful louvres on the sliding door to the little patio were a high point to this spacious yet cozy-feeling room. We flew in and didn't plan to get a car for our trip (the hotel is a bit out of the way for the downtown tourist destinations), but thanks to the super easy-to-use and very clean MTS public transit in San Deigo, we got around just fine, and inexpensively. I could pull up schedules, stop locations and best of all, *fully planned routes* based on my starting point and destination. Half a mile or so to the nearest stop, and we were cruising around effortlessly, and without having to worry about parking. (Well, MTS combined with the hop-on-hop-off Old Town Trolley tour, purchased online for more savings.) We even stopped at Trader Joe's for actual food items we could make in our room! But I ALSO highly recommend asking the front desk for the menu from Broadway Takeout, which serves and delivers very late into the night. Arriving after 11pm, we thought we'd make due with vending machine booty, but instead, we had a very hot and genuinely-fantastic pizza, with a burger that matched in heat, flavor, and quality... I'll only mention this because in leaving this review, I'm being asked to rate individual elements including sleep quality--and while the bed was nicely comfortable (not too soft, not too hard) the pillows were a little too much. Huge fluffy things which made sitting comfortably to relax watching TV from bed absolutely perfect, they were a little too whiplash-inducing to sleep on. I did without. And I didn't mind so much, actually. Humphrey's had reduced rates thanks to just-after-Labor-Day timing on our part, and we got free tickets to the zoo (which included the tram and sky-bucket thing) with the package we purchased directly from the hotel's website (I don't think this package was offered on Expedia or other conglomerate sites) and by booking through the hotel's direct site, I was also able to surprise my other half with chocolate-dipped strawberries waiting for us in-room on the first night (other options such as a fruit plate, wine & cheese, champagne service are available as well.) The shuttle drivers were delightful, as were the front desk staff. The lounge on-site was pretty cool, and the concert venue looks really fun--we'd like to catch a show on our next visit. Last but not least, the lush tropical feel of the grounds really does transport you to another place, and the pool area, putting green, and ping-pong table are also on our list for future enjoyment. I was expecting cute and a little sweetly-kitschy. I found an absolute gem. We're in love, and we'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Town”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne-Tom
Reviews.Content: The renovated room was beautiful. The grounds and pool area are lush. The staff very pleasent and helpful. The food at the onsite restaurant excellent and plentiful. The location is superb, easy access to the north for the attractions along the beachs, Sea World, etc. and around the harbor to downtown sites, neighborhoods and dining. The airport is close at hand but the flight patterns are such that you rarely hear the take-off noise. The concert venue is great, buy the packages if you want to see a show. An oasis that is just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Virgin for this recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: EMA2010
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Virgin, and we were very pleased upon arrival! The hotel is in a lovely location, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, clean, well maintained and overlooked the marina and stage (fortunately no shows!!) Only a short walk to the pool, which was very refreshing! The breakfast in the restaurant was very good, and the staff always pleasant. We liked this hotel so much we booked an extra night!

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal! I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: kjjclay
Reviews.Content: I just stayed this last weekend and I will continue to come back again and again! The rooms were clean, well decorated, and very cozy. The staff was very accomodating and extremly friendly. The food is amazing and very reasonable for a resort. Whether you are taking a vacation, staycation, or business.. Humphrey's Half Moon Inn is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Unusually Hawai'ian... An Oasis near the water...”
Reviews.Author: 2composers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on and after Labor Day. Reception was very helpful; my iPhone charger had given up, and Dawn brought us her own to allow charging our devices. WiFi in the whole compound, if you have more than one device, get two coupons with access code. Breakfast tasteful, cooked and served with care, the Eggs Benedict were among the best I've had. Upstairs Premier Room nice and clean, huge TV, comfortable bed and no noise from the parking lot we were facing; view of San Diego downtown across the water. Pool large and clean, with a true Polynesian setting... Happy Hour was fantastic, with a great Blues band (Chet and the Committee) with delish drinks and good food, very friendly service. Location is a bit away from restaurants, but we liked the walk. Newly opened CafÃ© and Bakery on Canon Road and Rosecrans, near a small shopping center. We took Bus 28 from nearby the hotel to Old Town, and then the Blue Line/Orange Line trolleys to Gas Lamp district, and did the same all the way back, for ten bucks, and saw a lot of the city and its history.

Reviews.Title: “Almost like a stay in Hawaii.”
Reviews.Author: dorightValleVista_CA
Reviews.Content: Everything at this destination is TOPS. Every morning as I take my walk along the Harbor walk (across the street) I thank the Lord for my being here. Have been coming to Humphrey's with famly and friends for over 12 years for 3 to 5 days at a time and 3 to 6 times a year. Have stayed at the Marriott, Sheraton, and Hilton in S.D. They are all very nice, but Humphrey's beats them all. Their staff is like being with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, worth the extra cost.”
Reviews.Author: Choppers70
Reviews.Content: I scrambled last minute to find a new hotel after a reading a miserable review about the one I had booked (next door). Humphreys was slightly more expensive and didn't have the included breakfast, (which would have been a big money saver in San Diego), but I'm so glad I made the change. Booked the "Premier" guest room and was upgraded to a tropical room but pretty sure all that meant was internal patio access rather than facing the parking lot. The parking lot rooms have a nice wall built up around the patio so it wouldn't have been bad at all. Room looked just like the website images. Beds were comfortable, room appeared to be clean. There is a slight damp smell if the AC gets turned down but that's to be expected in any area surrounded by water. I'm very sensitve to musty smells and I was FINE there. Pool was great, room service was great, grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. So convenient to everything in San Diego. Will absolutely stay there again. If you don't want to be kept up at night, request a room that is not overlooking the concert stage. If you like live music, definitely request one that does overlook the stage! (great deal as tickets are $80 +)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Big Suite, and Tropical Landscaping...”
Reviews.Author: SeeksTranquility
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this summer with a large group in the marina view suite.(1000 square feet) It was a wonderfully large group of rooms, and our view of the marina and surrounding hills was lovely. The kitchen was fully equipped and recently redone, and the bathroom was great, too. The dining room was large and included a spacious round table where one could fit 8-10 people. We arrived for check-in and were told that we couldn't be processed due to a computer problem. Our family group ranged in age from an infant to an elderly person and we had to wait for over an hour to check in to our room, but we were comfortable sitting in the lobby. Lots of other people were in our same predicament, and the desk clerks handled all the impatient people very well. One guy had a little temper tantrum and even threw an object, but the clerk ignored it and that non-reaction rather diffused the situation. Another guest simply picked up the launched object ( a paper cup), and deposited it in a trash bin. Our inconvenience was compensated by free parking for two days ($40.00 saved...2 cars) and also we had $50.00 knocked off the bill for the room so we were satisfied. We rated the place four stars instead of five due to the discomfort of the sofa beds and beds in the bedroom, but that's just taste. One of our party members loved the bed. A trip to Humphreys will happen again--to us it's a hidden little gem, and next time we will enjoy a concert there!

Reviews.Title: “When in San Diego, Humphreys is the best”
Reviews.Author: edol351
Reviews.Content: We've been taking vacations to San Diego for twenty years and stay exclusively at Humphreys. As soon as you walk through the front lobby to the pool area you have entered a lush, tropical garden with the sweet fragrances to match. The room we always book is a suite that faces the marina. The balcony view of the hundreds of boats moored and gently swaying gives one a wonderful sense of peace and relaxation. The suite itself is large with a bedroom, living room, kitchen, dressing area, a double sink bathroom and flat screen televisions. The shower is marble and the kitchen and bathroom countertops are granite. The suite is large, airy, and bright. Recent renovations have made it all the more inviting although before the renovations the accommodations were just fine. The entire staff, from front desk to house cleaning, has always been friendly, courteous, professional in attitude, and quick to respond to all you needs and requests, and kudos to the landscaping staff who do such an outstanding job maintaining the exquisite flora that adorns the entire site of the hotel. We've dined at the hotel's restaurant on many occasions. It has always been a fabulous dining experience (the seafood offerings are to die for!). The restaurant also boasts one of the city's finest wine lists. If your into music this is the place to be. Humphreys has a concert series that brings in some of the greatest pop music performers of today and yesterday. But, get your tickets early since they're sell out often. The Shelter Island location is ideal since you can get to any of the city's attractions in about ten to fifteen minutes. At vacation time it's always San Diego, and it's always Humphreys.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Deal but Some Cons”
Reviews.Author: batman8072
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Humphreys for years and in the beginning it was hit or miss. I noticed a number of guests had some really negative things to say about the rooms and so I wanted to add my review to help provide some insight. Since Humphreys began renovating the rooms a few years back, I've now learned to always book the renovated room vice the suites which are a bit outdated. They have been completely redone and are both roomy and really comfortable. It's nice to come back to your room after a long day and just plop down on a big comfy bed or sit on your patio enjoying the bay breeze. The pool is nice and always clean and you cannot beat the room price & view. Especially in the off season. The renovated rooms have a large, flat screen tv, microwave, refrigerator and free high speed internet. They also have a mailing list where you'll receive great room package deals. The customer service varies. Housekeeping and room service staff are among some of the nicest people I've encountered when traveling. (The room service menu is excellent by the way and the french toast is to die for.) The front desk can be a challenge. They frequently seem to be short handed or have someone a little inept working during the prime check in/out times and if the computer in the business center isn't working, there doesn't seem to be anyone on-site to help. If you can get one of the renovated rooms, I would highly recommend chosing Humphreys for your next trip to San Diego. It's in a quite location on Shelter Island but only a short drive to everything San Diego has to offer.
