Thursday and Friday night went by and it was a bit annoying but I wasn't going to let it ruin my vacation. After all we were the ones that decided to stay in that particular room. They had offered us a room on the second floor but in the same building - so it wouldn't have made much of a difference. (HINT: If someone from Humphrey's is reading this..if a guest stays in these buildings during three nights of concerts, it would probably be a good idea to at least comp. them free tickets to at least one of the three events - you would recieve less complaints - kind of a "if you can't beat them, join them" philosophy) Well by Saturday night we decided to stay away for the majority of the concert and come back late in the evening to avoid the mess. We got back at 10:30pm (concert started at 7pm). The concert was still going on but we expected it to wrap up soon based on past experience. Here is how the rest of our night went: 11:00pm - concert wrapped up 12:00am - Drunk people out in the hallway yelling. 12:30am - Drunk people still yelling - called front desk. Security came and people left. 1:00am - Wake up to hear the sound off dripping water - our sink was mysteriously overflowing with water (we did not have the water on!) It was overflowing onto the carpet - called front desk. Maintenence guy came and fixed problem. 1:30am - Drunk people back again. 2:30am - Drunk people back again. We were told that these people were part of the band from the concert. The next mornign we complained to the front desk and after some discussion they eventually comp'd us our room rate for our last night stay. This is a very nice hotel and I would have enjoyed it if it weren't for the building (concerts) we were in. I felt for the amount we paid (250/night) we shouldn't have to put up with it if we weren't there to see the concert(s). Great Hotel if you want go specifically for these concerts though!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: JJWBDO
Reviews.Content: After reading some on the reviews about Humphreys my friends and I decided to book this hotel, even though there were a couple of a negative reviews. Every hotel will have some kind of negative right? So we decided to take our chances and were amazed by what we got for the price. We booked a trip deal and got a really good deal on this hotel. The hotel is on the bay on Shelter Island, so it was about 10 minutes from the airport. Didnt bother us at all. We didnt have to deal with all of the downtown hustle and bustle all day. The hotel grounds were beautiful and peaceful and the staff was very friendly. We had a bay view and were able to sleep with our windows open at night. One previous review stated the pillows were flat, we didnt have that experience, but it did look like the hotel had been updated recently. The rooms were smaller than normal, but very quaint and comfy. The concert venue that the hotel has is great too. Even though we didnt buy tickets to the concerts, we did listen to the concerts from the hotel pool and hot tub in the evenings. Very entertaining. I could go on about the hotel, but I wont. I would definitely recommend Humphreys for someone who is looking for a nice hotel on the bay for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PB1952
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in early May 2007 and had no complaints. The room style is basic and, as a previous reviewer said, they are not suites but were very comfortable and well provided. I also agree the lighting in the rooms was a little poor. We found the staff helpful and efficient and the pool area very peaceful and relaxing and virtually deserted when we used it about 6pm after a day's sightseeing. We found about three other restaurants within easy walking distance but only tried one - the Bali Hai at the left hand end of shelter island as you drive on to it. Most of the meal was excellent although I did have to send my main course back. However I think this was an isolated problem, I just got an undercooked one and they dealt with it without any qualms or arguments. For most people I suspect the clincher for or against the Humphreys Half Moon is their series of summer concerts on their open air stage. This year's schedule includes the Beach Boys, Huey Lewis and the News, UB40, Steve Winwood through to kd Lang, Lyle Lovett and Queen Latifah plus numerous others. It's worth checking out their web site to see who's playing during your stay. Tickets prices look quite reasonable - particularly with the current exchange rate against the Â£ - but you can probably hear them for free from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Long-established property in semi-tropical surroundings on the rather plain and ordinary Shelter Island. Some distant aircratft noise from the International Airport and intermittent(but not frequent) loud aircraft noise from the naval base on Coronado Island, which is across the bay. After three weeks of really friendly welcome in a range of hotels on our vacation, we found the reception staff efficient but bar staff somewhat aloof and restaurant staff rather brusque. The food in Humphrey's restaurant was good quality but pricey--fairly elegant surroundings overlooking the marina--lots of boat masts actually! Room service was fine but not the cheapest around with a compulsory 18% service charge--there is a dearth of restaurants nearby and none within walking distance. We had a "bay-facing suite"-- more masts,(!) and the bay just visible through the trees and across the busy car park--the suite not a suite at all but a bedroom with table and chairs plus a very compact bathroom. Comfortable king size bed, large picture windows Air con efficient but noisy on medium or high settings and an extremely rattly extractor fan in the bathroom.The room was not as well lit as it ought to be, though clean and well serviced. This is definitely only a three star and expectations should not be over high. We had no serious complaints but would not return--a feeling of disappointment because the hotel does not live up to its brochure--they even charge for parking now, even though the brochure in the room says its free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: SOLSETA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3nts from 30 March. Our rooms overlooked the pool in F block - could not fault the rooms at all they were v.large and nicely decorated. Our room had two doubles and they were v. comfortable. The pool and the gardens are lovely. The staff were really friendly - free wifi in the rooms plus internet and printer in the lobby. The location on Shelter island is great - nice and calm great views over SD and the harbour but also close to drive to all the attractions. The restaurant is great and the Sunday brunch is to die for !!!! I will be staying here again and would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey was okay”
Reviews.Author: boxsilver
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through priceline and was happy to get a 3 star hotel. When we arrived, the things we noticed were: Location: Good- close to airport. Hotel has free shuttle; however since we arrived at midnight, the shuttle was not available to pick us up. good seafood places around there. Price: Ok- no real perks Distance from lobby - our room was a bit far from the lobby. A little bit of inconvenience to walk to get info and the free morning coffees. or the internet access Parking ; $8 a night We had kids with stroller, so make sure u get a room on the 1st level so u don't have to drag luggage and stroller up a flight of stairs. would i stay again? most likely not

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's - Family Hotel and Great Jumping Off Point to SD activities”
Reviews.Author: JerseyDad
Reviews.Content: Humphrey's is a very good hotel to stay while visiting San Diego. I would say it's a 3-star hotel and the grounds and pool are very good. The real benefit is that Shelter Island is a terrific location to get everywhere in SD by car. Rooms They have Jr Suites and Marina Suites that are ideal for families (large with kithchenettes and refrigerators) that can easily accomodate 5-6. And they will bring in a cot or blow-up mattress too. The rooms are clean although dated. Because the rooms are dated, this hotel gets some bad reviews. We liked how the bathroom sink was outside the bathroom and the set-up of the room was spacious and terrific. The mattresses could use an update. I'd recommend staying on the second floor as you will get nice views of either the marina or harbor. Concierge The hotel concierge is wonderful (you won't find better than Donna in the area) and she saved us lots of money and time. If you stay here call her in advance and she'll really help you. She used to be the concierge at the Catamaran and she said she likes the Shelter Island location better to get around San Diego which we agree with. Pool The pool is large and a good one for kids and families. No frills to it (like a water slide) but it's a big pool with a hot tub located about 20 yards away so the kids and adults will like it. Also have a ping pong table and a little putting green which the kids got full use of. Shelter Island Location We can't recommend staying in this area enough. After being there for a week and doing everything in San Diego we love this location. 5-10 mins to downtown. 10 mins to the zoo. 15 to Sea World. 20 to La Jolla (if you take I-5). 10 to Old Town. And beautiful views of the harbor and marinas all around. If you are a boat enthusiast stay here and your mouth will drop when you see all the yachts and sail boats around this peninsula. Nice place to walk or run in the morning if you like that (very safe) and you can also use Humphrey's bikes too. Also lots of good restaurants within 3-5 mins by car and a few that you can walk to. We liked Pizza Nova (inexpensive), Point Loma Seafood (inexpensive) and the restaurant at the hotel. They do charge $8 for parking every day which is less than most of the SD hotels. We found that most of the hotels charge for parking (consider it just another SD tax I guess). Don't stay here if you want a brand new room, and you are super picky about having a perfect room. Stay here if you are a family looking for a larger clean room and you are on the go and want to see San Diego. We really enjoyed staying at Humphrey's because the pool was great, our room (a Jr Suite) was large enough for our family of 5, the concierge was way above average and the location was the best place to stay if you want to do it all in SD. Some of the posters that complain about the rooms are spoiled and stay in 5 star hotels all the time. If you are a AAA member you can save too. We were there a week and they had 3 weddings on the grounds there. The grounds are full of flora and flowers and very pretty. Also check the concert schedule if you are coming between May and Sept as they have outdoor concerts. For some that might attract you and for others you might not want to be there during a concert because of the noise. By the way - the restaurant is fantastic. One of our best meals in San Diego. I would call it upscale casual. Everything melted in our mouths and we are picky about food. A little expensive but well worth it and we hear the Sunday Brunch is terrific. This restaurant overlooks the marina - nice. Finally, lots of Europeans seem to be attracted to this hotel which we liked. Overall we liked Humphrey's for a family on the go that also enjoys coming back for a nice swim. We'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch with Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: SmallTownAZ
Reviews.Content: We booked a six night nonrefundable stay at Humphrey's based on the number of supportive and good reviews from other travelers. BUT NOW we will advise our friends and relatives to stay away. The pluses were that the grounds were very nice and the front desk staff was helpful. But if you don't spend your time in the lobby or in the gardens, this is not the hotel for you. The room was a 40 year old nightmare. The pillows were 1/2 the size of standard size ones and without much stuffing. Even with 3 of them together, it didn't help much. The mattress was abysmally hard. The bed linens were sparse and the wall paper (especially in the bathroom) looked the 40 years old. In addition, the room was very dark, especially in the bathroom. (This is not a place where you want dark lighting). Finally, this hotel was supposed to be a 3 star hotel. There is no way that this hotel room made even a 2 and 1/2 star rating. It's just not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's Half Moon Inn And Suites gets 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: howellpix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 4 days in San Diego before visiting friends and relatives upstate. We stayed at Humphrey's Half Moon In and Suites on Shelter Island (on advice from forum) and it was absolutely perfect. Shelter Island is off the beaten path, pleasantly quiet with beautiful views of downtown and the harbor, but close to everything. We loved the tropically landscaped grounds and pool, the large comfortable room, the service and the restaurant. We walked to the Bali Hai restaurant across the roundabout for a fabulous dinner with a view one night, and drove to Miguel's at nearby Scott Street another. It was lovely not to have to drive far at night for dinner, after touring all day. We love to walk, and so enjoyed exploring Old Town, Little Italy, the Gaslamp district, University Heights, and of course, the zoo and Balboa Park. We loved the public park, music and outdoor cafes on Coronado Island, with beautiful views back toward town. We also drove over to see the Del, which was charming, but the traffic was bumper to bumper all the way. And the restaurant menu was disappointing -right on the water and no fresh seafood, so we didn't stay. We also enjoyed walking around La Jolla, having lunch in a sidewalk cafe, and were enchanted by the seals and pups at the cove. The museum of modern art, which is there, was also nice, and we drove up the winding roads in the hills to see the houses and views. Having never been to San Diego before, we were surprised at how much we liked it. It's a great climate, very pretty, easy layout and manageable traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: howellpix
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego, and I want to say that "rif'fs mom's" advice was right on the money. We spent 4 nights at Humphrey's Half Moon Inn and Suites and didn't want to leave. If anyone wants a pleasant ambiance in a quiet location with lovely pool and grounds, this is the perfect retreat. There is little traffic, it's close to all attractions, has a good restaurant and a beautiful view of S.D. cityscape. We walked across the roundabout to the Bali Hai restaurant one night and had a fabulous meal with a view. A short drive to Scott Street and we had another fun meal at Miguel's. The staff at Humphrey's were very friendly and efficient, but non-intrusive. After driving to all the attractions in the San Diego area, I wouldn't stay anywhere other than Humphrey's. Coronado is lovely but too much traffic. We had a great time and really appreciate your advice.

Reviews.Title: “I like Humphries, but other hotels in area are nice too!”
Reviews.Author: jetlagnow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at plenty of San Diego hotels and Shelter Island is one of the best locations. Humphries is pretty nice. Love the tropical decor (which has been duplicated by the other newer local hotels). The pool is nice and so is the general layout of the hotel and the rooms. Love the low key atmosphere of the grounds. Drawbacks have been: Office staff are a bit punchy or grouchy. Have been turned down before for a room after they asked how many nights I was staying and I only said "one." Their reply "we're sold out". Went next door to the Best Western which accomodated me, no problem. Other drawbacks: rooms have that "party" smell and vibe (like a lot of rock and rollers have stayed there and soiled the rooms). Which makes sense because Humphries hosts bands during the summer time and they likely stay in the hotel rooms (as do locals who want to party). So rooms are a little too dirty for my taste. Pluses: location is great and beautiful. Have had room upgraded by staff before on a non-busy night. Just love the atmosphere. Only wish they would upgrade the rooms a bit, lower the price and keep the rooms cleaner (carpet steaming anyone?). Overall grade: B.

Reviews.Title: “Was very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler4545
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Humphrey's and was very happy with the room, the property, the staff, the cleanliness, and the location. We had a nice suite overlooking the marina and the stage (no acts performed while we were there)--many rooms have their own balconies/patios. The room was spacious, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The hotel staff all went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Ate at the hotel's restaurant several times and found the food and prices to be fine. Be sure to ask for a room overlooking the marina, otherwise you'll have a room overlooking the parking lot which lies between the hotel, the park across the street (with its large parking lot) and the harbor. The views from the marina rooms are really nice--an endless array of boats with the hills of La Playa as a backdrop--hopefully you'll see some of the same beautiful sunsets that we did. The landscaped grounds reminded me of stays in more tropical locations with lots of jungle-like plants and meandering paths. It has a nice size pool and hot tub which are easily accesible from from all rooms. Lots of places to read and lounge in the pool area. Also saw a small putting green on the grounds and an outdoor table tennis table which seemed to get quite a bit of use. Across the street from the hotel is a nice walking path that winds along a park next to the water. A short walk from the hotel are several restaurants, and cafes, including an excellent Mexican restaurant that is very popular. You'll need a car at this hotel--San Diego is a suburban city and the sites are miles apart, so plan on renting a car anyway. I'd say it would be difficult and time consuming to visit this city and rely exclusively on public transportation. The hotel is centrally located for tourists and is only about 5-10 minutes from the airport, about 10-15 minutes from downtown (be sure to go to the gas light district at night to have dinner), about 20 minutes from Pacific Beach (a big beach scene), and about 25 min from La Jolla. Unless you want a beach front hotel, this would be a fine choice for your trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit.”
Reviews.Author: mmsoko
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this Inn about 10 years ago and remembered it fondly. The grounds are parklike, with a fish pond, parrots in the bushes and ducks that welcome you to your patio. The pool area is very nice, with additional activities like ping-pong table, bar, and putting green. The weather was cool, but two young girls from Denver were certainly enjoying the heated pool. My husband, 17yo son and I shared a junior suite. It may have been the room we were in ten years ago...looked the same. Spacious, two TVs(a must with a teenager.), and clean. Although there is a restaurant onsite, it seemed to have limited hours and there wasn't anything close to walk to. We ended up using the hotel as our base for siteseeing San Diego. It would probably be a better hotel to spend some time enjoying the grounds and amenities. You definitely need a car for this location. We stayed three nights and weren't unhappy but I don't know that I would stay at this location again for visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKS !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Surefolly
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 2 1/2 year old son and I just spend 3 nights at Humphrey's and thought that it was great. The place is an oasis - palm trees, banana trees, bamboo - it's a south pacific / tiki paradise. I would stay there again for sure. The only warning I would give is that they do hold outdoor concerts there from May until October. They pack about 1,700 people in for the shows. If you are planning to stay there, ask about the concerts first.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromUK
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from nearly 3 weeks in California, Stayed at Humphreys after consulting tripadvisor. Some people moaned about the size of the rooms, ours was great my husband and I and Our 10 year old son spent 8 nights here. The Location was fantastic we didn't drive for more than 15 minutes to anywhere. We didn't eat here the restaurant was too pricey for us. The room was very well appointed, clean and comfortable. Check-in took moments as did check-out. Staff were always courtious and helpful. My son loved the Pool area which we had a great view of from our room. We loved San Diego for families it was great we visited Balboa park, the zoo, Sea world, La Jolla Cove (seals on the beach with their pups) Gaslamp district, Old Town (do the trolley tour) my son loved the USS Midway which was brought to life for him by all the veterans telling him how it all worked. We wnet whale watching on the Hornblower saw whales, Seals and Dolphins! I would recommend San Diego to anyone who asks me and Humphreys was a great location to explore it from.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic & secluded, yet convenient getaway!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelSeeker
Reviews.Content: My spouse's and my first visit to SD. Spent 4 nights here and couldn't imagine a better place. Positives: Location - 5 minute drive to downtown, Marina/Sea World, and Sunset views off the Pacific, yet still secluded on man-made isle. Quaint shops/cafes within 30 sec drive give a local touch. Chief Concierge - Best I have ever had. Great listener: Spent time getting to know us, and tailored recommendations from our conversations. Her knowledge of the area was vast - not just tourist attractions, but local places that help us to see the real character of the different areas. Every recommendation was spot-on and top notch! Pool - large, relaxing, and mostly secluded with greenery, from rest of resort. Whirlpool was excellent. Staff - each staff member I interacted with had the same disposition of helping the guest. Had a minor question about room rate and length of stay, and manager promptly and politely addressed it. Landscaping - The well layed out palm trees and various other kinds of greenery creates a great secluded atmosphere Negatives: Only one thing keeping resort from top-notch status: Noise between rooms. Heard guest above us get out-of-bed, walk around, open close dresser, talk on cell-phone, etc. He apparently only stayed one night, but could have been an issue if he stayed longer. If staying here when fully booked / concert season, would recommend contacting front-desk ahead of arrival to secure quiet room location.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Natalie580
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay at Humphrey's to celebrate his birthday. I booked Queen Room with an Ocean view in advanced and was surprised to learn when we checked in that they upgraded our room to a Marina View suite. It the room and marina view we so nice. They even had champagne waiting for us in our room when we arrived. The more we walked around the hotel, the more we liked it. We ordered room service twice and the food was pretty good. The concierge was helpful with directions. On Sunday morning, we went swimming in the pool which was the perfect temperature. We had a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brit63izzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last week in October 2006 for a meeting. Had heard some not-go-good things about the hotel, so was a little apprehensive. I was attending a meeting there with about 100 people, and had heard negative things about the conference rooms. I have to say, the conference rooms are GREAT!...the service was impeccable, so the meetings went very well. My room (I was fortunate enough to have a 2nd floor room that overlooked the bay). It was a nice room, quite roomy and comfortable. If there was a bad thing, I would say it was the service at the lobby when I checked in. Two people at the desk, both ignored me for probably 1-2 minutes (doesn't sound like a long time, but when you're the ONLY one in the lobby, it was rather odd). Finally got recognized, and the young man said, he would be with me shortly. Again, I kept standing. Finally he finished his "paperwork" and checked me in "somewhat reluctantly". Never could figure out why the terse treatment at the front desk, because the rest of the service was great throughout the week. I do have one quick story.....eating lunch in the restaurant (very good food by the way). The waiter (female) came to give us the check, one person in my party said they only had a $20, so if the waiter could break it (read here...a tip would be coming), the waiter said, "I don't have change" (somewhat snotty). She left, brought back the others at our table credit card receipts and brought the other person's $20 bill back. We just laughed....so much for her tip! Again, it's a nice hotel, the grounds are superb, the marina is a refreshing view, and the BEST BEST BEST walk of the morning is along the bay....beautiful path, sounds of sea lions, watching boats (and cruiseships), pelicans flying overhead....absolutely peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Really glad we stayed at Humphrey's...”
Reviews.Author: BEF
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with a water view and found that the view we had when we checked in was not what we were expecting. Our water view was across the parking lot and was not as nice as the rooms on the other side. However, the room itself was nice and the beds were comfortable. The next morning we went to the front desk just to see if there were other rooms available on the side we were interested in and the woman at the front desk was so friendly, professional and made a room change for us on the spot. We were moved to a room with a balcony and a view of all the boats in the marina via the outdoor concert stage are for the same price as our original room. We could not have been happier with how wonderful she was to us! The food at the restaurant was great both times we ate there - the light dinner and hearty breakfast were both great - the wait staff attentive and friendly. One suggestion if you're interested in massage or manicure/pedicure type treatments would be to make arrangements before your arrival if you can (with the concierge). Overall we were very happy with our 5 night stay at Humphrey's and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tibbyoreo
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3-year old son, and I stayed here for two nights while we were on vacation in San Diego. It was great being right across the street from the ocean, although I was a little disappointed that it's a fishing pier, not a beach. The hotel was nice and comfortable, but the most outstanding thing was the staff. They really went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and to make our stay the best they could. I would definitely stay again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for the Humphrey's!”
Reviews.Author: Forest1963
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be upgraded when we arrived and found ourselves in a room overlooking the concert venue and marina. We enjoyed a couple of live shows, watching them from our balcony. The pool area is great - towels laid out on the beds, a lovely pool bar with a tropical feel. All beautifully clean. The staff were very helpful, particularly the concierge. The restaurant is lovely if you want to stay onsite - large windows give you a panoramic view of the marina, and again the staff were attentive and friendly. If you want to go out there are plenty of places to eat - catering for all tastes and wallets. The room was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and very clean. If you are booking then request a room that is not overlooking the car park. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at HHM and would love to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Humphrey's Half-Moon Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: sunshyne53
Reviews.Content: My husband & I are seasoned travelers and found this hotel one of the most surperb places we have ever been! Everything was great. Our room was located right at the edge of the concert area. We loved sitting out on the deck watching and listing to Emmy Lou Harris! A free concert for us because of our location. All the music from the concert ends at a decent hour - we are senior citizens and decent hour hour for us is much earlier than most. We hope to return to this hotel each year. And we would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone! The saff was wonderful. We made new friends. Everything and more that could possibly be expected was available. And by the way, our trip to San Diego was a wedding anniversary trip! Although no one at the hotel, restaurant or lounge was aware of our special reason for our trip, they made us feel like we were a king & queen. Try it - you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: PHXDude
Reviews.Content: Got three rooms for Sat and Sunday on labor day weekend for a total of $820 via priceline and I will say its money very well spent. Perfect location, near to almost every popular attraction in city...plenty of dining options nearby... very good rooms.. good size.. clean crisp linens... comfy bed..., plenty of towels etc.. very good retaurent on property (a bit costly though).. certainly recommand and certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Staying Here Again, What A Dump!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RLUVINLIFE
Reviews.Content: Where do I even begin........ we checked in at night, which was fast....but......... as soon as we entered the room....I felt like I was in the movie psycho..... The room stunk like I can't even describe.. thank goodness I brought candles to kill the odor... The sheets were another story...they didn't even have a mattress cover over the mattress, GROSS!!!!!!! THE SHEETS WERE DIRTY...THEY HAD A BLACK STAIN, CAN YOU IMAGINE THAT!!! I I had the worse night of my life......I didn't fall asleep until 4am. This place was the biggest dump I have ever encountered. The other people who stayed here must of had a few too many drinks at the lounge to even recognize trash when THEY see it!!!!! We checked out the very next day and went a REAL HOTEL, "THE MARRIOTT" NEVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! FOLKS BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “High Recommend--Excellent in ALL Areas”
Reviews.Author: ChoosePeace
Reviews.Content: Wow...what a wonderful place....the Chief Concierge, Donna Frey was so helpful, as were her assistants. The grounds were paradise. It was so hard to leave this place. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to relax after a tiring day”
Reviews.Author: Traveller928
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from July 23-28, 2006. First the good reviews: 1.) it's got a tropical theme and the view from the terrace is really relaxing; 2.) the junior suite we got is really big with 1 king bed and a pullout queen plus 2 TV's; 3.) the concierge is really good. She knows her way all around SD. But that is where the good things end. Now the cons: 1.) the room is far from the front desk. We had to lug our luggages to our room around 100 m away. There was nobody to help us ! And we had to go up 2 flights of stairs to our room. 2.) Parking is not free and NO breakfast; 3.) After a tiring day, we couldn't sleep bec of the noise of the concert. Even if we close the doors, the noise could still get through. We only had 1 quiet night when we were there. 4.) The laundry room has only 2 washing machines & 2 dryers. 1 dryer is not even heating up properly. I had 2 to load my laundry twice to dry it up. 5.) The change machine in the laundry room is not working; 6.) the cleaners & the workers don't speak English. Conversation is very hard unless you go to the front desk -- a 100m away.

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sandcastles_dp
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for seceral days in the month of July 06 for my sister's wedding and enjoyed every minute of it. The inn is a little bit rustic, but clean, relaxing and comfortable. I would sugget getting a suite if you can afford to spend a little more it is well worth it. The suites face the harbor and have a good size patio with a table and four chairs. The service was excellent all of our requests were answered timely and courteously. The pool was large and has a full bar. They are have a a club with live music on site that is free to guests. The first night was a Jazz band and the second night was a rock band. The club also has a view of the bay. My family and I will be returning in spring.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesd7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in a View Suite. We had been touring round California for the last 2 weeks and were exhausted (we are from England). We were really looking forward to San Diego and it didnt disappoint. Infact we felt it was our best place in CA. We were given an upgrade and so faced the marina. This was lovely, we had a little patio with table and chairs. The ducks came every day and my daughter just loved feeding them. We loved the pool and enjoyed listening to all the concerts, especially Olivia Newton John. We felt very privaledged to be able to hear this lovely music with our glass of wine. You could sit in the huge spa and listen to the concerts, bliss! Our suite was very big and had a lovely big bathroom and dressing area, nice big kitchen and 2 TV's. It was a bit drab and brown, and could have done with a little bit of colour, but otherwise was very nice. I would definately recommend this hotel and would love to come again. We left with heavy heart and could easily have stayed atleast another week. A great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, if you don't want to go to bed before 10:30pm”
Reviews.Author: CATravelin
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Humphrey's last week for two nights. First night was fine but second night was lousy due to the concert. I spent 1.5 hours trying to get my 3yo daughter to sleep because the concert was so loud (we were in block D of rooms, lower floor). On the plus side, the pool is quite big and clean though the hot tub was VERY hot. The rooms are okay, not too big. We did have a nice little "patio" right outside our door and we could see the pool area. There are Bay views towards downtown but they are all across a parking lots plus a street so don't be fooled by the picture you see here. Parking was not an issue either night but we did get in early, before the concert started. Restaurant is nice and convienent but if you plan to go for dinner make sure you make reservations. We did eat bfast there two days and the service is slow so not great for kids. The second day though our service was horrible with no cream cheese for the bagel with cream cheese (it was never brought out - we had to grab some from the Continental Bfast but by then the bagel was cold). My Humphrey's pancakes came without the fruit on them and so were cold by the time that was resolved. I would stay there again but would make sure not to have kids with me, or else to request to be in the rooms all the way away from the concert area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nada PM
Reviews.Content: The four adults in our group stayed at Humphrey's for MCRD graduation and had a great time. Our room was a suite which had a separate living room and it was very spacious. The cost was a little higher than other hotels but the size of the room was well worth it. We were also upgraded to a bay view room on the second floor with a great view of the bay from the balcony. Although it was close to the airport, we never heard the planes in the room, only on the balcony. The overall appearance and cleanliness of the hotel was fantastic. The grounds are remarkable, with huge tropical plants and lots of flowers. Although we didn't swim in the pool it looked clear and inviting. The service is the best feature at Humphrey's! Everyone was fantastically helpful and friendly, from the desk clerks to the shuttle driver. For example, my daughter and friend wanted to rent a car for the day to go to Mexico. The concierge made arrangements and the shuttle drove them to the car rental office. When they discovered they couldn't rent with a check card, the hotel shuttle driver took them to the train station and helped them with schedules. The concierge also printed our boarding passes when I couldn't get the printer in the lobby to work, and called a taxi for my son and his friend. The concert venue was great, although I heard one family whose balcony faced the stage say that it felt like the concert was in their room. We took our chairs to the landing and watched for free. Some of the hotel staff told us we could also watch by the pool area and they were serving snacks and drinks to hotel guests. We were asked to show our room keys but the staff was very friendly. The concerts always end at 10:30 PM, but if you have small children or have an early morning, get a room away from the amphitheater. The location was scenic, with great jogging trails and a park on the bay across the street. There was a sailboat regatta one day that we watched from our balcony, and lots of military and other ship traffic. The hotel also provides bicycles, free for the first hour with a fee applying after that. We did not have an automobile so we didn't have to deal with parking. We ate at the hotel restaurant twice and had room service twice. We all thought it was great food. It was somewhat pricey, but the quality and menu variety were very good. There are not very many other restaurants near, although if you can walk several blocks you can find several. Since the hotel shuttle took us to the airport and MCRD events, we don't really know how convenient it is to other attractions, but it was perfect for our MCRD graduation visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all we had hoped it would be...”
Reviews.Author: Shoegirl70
Reviews.Content: When researching hotels for our SD trip, we were looking for a nice hotel with a tropical theme. The grounds are very tropical and the pool area was nice. Hotel however is dated. Check in was 30 minutes, with 2 staff checking people in at 4:00pm on a Saturday. We had reserved a bay view room, and were given a pool view room (a so called upgrade); I explained that we wanted a bay view room. (We reserved a bay view room and that is what we expect to get for $200/night.) We were then given a room that was explained as an upgrade with a view of the bay in building A. The â€œview of the bayâ€� was across a parking area, a street and then another parking area. How disappointing! And when there was a concert (4 out of the 6 nights we were there), the bands BIG equipment truck was parked right in front of our view. Our room had the oddest configuration. I could touch the entry door from the bed, it was so close. Then there was a narrow kitchen area with a sink and a frig., then another larger seating area which opened to a patio thru a sliding glass door. I think the designer of the room was a little confused, the sleeping area and the seating area should have been reversed. Just a small note, there was no bureau in the room, we had to live out of our suitcases. The location of the room, which we would find out, was right next to the concert entrance. On concert nights, we were kept awake by the concert, the concert goers leaving and the band breaking down their equipment and putting it in the big trucks. If you are planning on getting an early start to your day, ask for a room far from the concert area. Parking seemed to be an issue on concert nights. We were reluctant to leave our room if we were going to come back before the concert got over, because we were not sure if we were going to get parking. The one night (our last night) that we did leave and come back before the concert was over; we did get a spot near the lobby. The head concierge Donna, was very nice before we got there thru emails. Her night replacement seemed new and a little unsure of herself and the surrounding area. But she was very pleasant. I would not return to Humphreyâ€™s.

Reviews.Title: “Humphreys is a winner”
Reviews.Author: suru
Reviews.Content: We booked the "One Enchanted Evening" package for our anniversary and had an enjoyable stay. We arrived early and our room was ready. The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and professional, as was every staff member we ran into. We had a bay view room which wasn't exactly on the bay. There was a parking lot, street, and a grassy parkway between the hotel and the bay, but we just put chairs up by the window and when we sat down we could only see the bay which was nice. We walked down the path to the end of the island and when we returned to the room there was a HUGE basket of fruit and king-sized candy bars plus a bottle of nice champagne. You get to keep the glasses as part of the package. It was very relaxing sitting at the window snacking on fruit and drinking the champagne and watching all the boats sail by on the bay. The room was very well appointed and nicely decorated. The bathroom was beautiful with granite counter tops and around the tub. The room was spotless and well-insulated from noise. The only complaint about the room was that it was the size of a postage stamp. There was barely room to put the chairs between the bed and the window, and maybe 18 inches of space between the other side of the bed (king) and the wall. It did have high sloped ceilings which helped. There was a concert the night of our stay and even though we didn't have tickets, we were able to sit on a small balcony and listen. The pool area was very nice, and the rest of the grounds were wonderful and full of tropical landscaping. We checked out the rooms on the marina side which I thought had a much nicer view because they were right on the marina with a nice balcony or a patio and a little grassy area (no parking lot), but my husband thought our bay room view was better because the ships and boats were moving in the water, rather than tied up to berths. I guess it just depends on what you're looking for. In the morning we recieved breakfast in bed and the food was presented nicely and the room service was actually 5 minutes early. The food was good, not exactly outstanding, but room service food never is. To sum it all up, I felt the only negative about our stay was the small (albiet spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated) room, but the great service, super-friendly staff, beautiful grounds, and relaxing atmosphere made Humphreys a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked into Humphrey's, Thursday before Memorial Day weekend. I had stayed at this hotel before and loved it. It has a good location to the city and you can travel in different directions easily. The tropical motiff is relaxing. We had a ground level room facing the pool. It has a small patio to enjoy the scenery. Pool and hottub are large and kept clean. They have an outdoor concert area that is an added bonus. No concerts my weekend but check their website after March and see some great entertainers. Beautiful, peaceful and relaxing. Can't go wrong checking out a visit here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDuo6
Reviews.Content: We were also at Half Moon Inn the weekend of May 19th for three nights and had a great time. Our room was ready early and it was lovely. The place was full and there were a number of weddings but the staff was very nice and very accomodating. We did have to wait for a bell man when we arrived but at checkout we simply asked for a cart and there were plenty available. I was able to check out on the TV so I didn't have to wait in line. Room service was prompt and better than most hotels. The security was excellent and they were very good about not just giving out duplicate room keys if you lost one. The pool area is nice, pool bar is great and the place was very clean and well kept. I would absolutely stay again - in fact we made reservations to return before we left!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend, what a mistake. The check in time was way too long. There was only one person checking people in at 4:00 on a Friday. I waited in line for about 40 minutes before someone else came up from the back. When she started to get my info a lady walk up with some sunglasses from the gift shop she wanted to purchase. Apparently there isn't a cashier in the gift shop so the hotel employee proceeds to ask me to wait while she rang up the items! I couldn't believe it especially since I had been waiting in line for so long. The hotel room was old and DINGY!!! There was a disgusting musty smell throughout the room, and the carpet was GROSS! We only had a shower in our room (Unfortunate for my son) which was very old and run down. The walls are paper thin. I did not get a wink of sleep because there were super noisy people upstairs. They didn't go to sleep until 2 am and woke up at 4:30am. I guess they were in a wedding and they had quite a few issues with communication. I know this because I heard everything they said, including the argument about necklaces at 5am! We went to the rest. for breakfast. The wait was so long we asked if we could take the food to go since we were running late for an appt. We were told the only way we could take the food is if we ordered room service. I had a very hungry and upset 5-year-old and the staff did not seem to care. When we were ready to check out I called the front desk for help. We were told the bell man doubles as the shuttle driver and he was not on there because he was driving the shuttle. When I went to get a cart there were none available... We will never stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Humphrey's”
Reviews.Author: damj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphrey's 4 nights in April 2006. After 3 days in LA and Disney, we wanted a relaxing hotel near the bay/ocean with a pool, and after reading reviews of most of the other hotels in the area, Humphrey's really stood out, and after staying there, I have to agree with the glowing recommendations of this hotel. It's located on San Diego Bay on Shelter Island, near the airport (but not in the flight path, so noise isn't an issue). Getting in an around is very easy and convienient. There are lots of good looking restaurants around, but we didn't get to try any. The Hotel is in a Polynesian theme with alot of lush vegetation on the grounds. We had a ground floor room facing the inner courtyard, near the pool. We were also near the fish pond and the parrots (which my young kids loved). There were also several families of ducks wandering around the grounds, which the kids loved feeding. There are nice activities on the grounds, including a very nice heated pool, jacuzzi, croquet, and a putting green, plus San Diego bay is across the street for a nice walk and view of downtown San Diego. The rooms are large, and well appointed, with an ironing board, refrigerator, and curling iron. We had room service, and the entrees were a little pricey, but the food was very good. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our refrigerator, but we called maintenance and it was fixed a short time later. We wanted a beautiful, comfortable and relaxing hotel in San Diego, and this Hotel more than delievered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: 7503Happyrock
Reviews.Content: We spend four days there and was impressed by the Property. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The staff was very helpful. The property is only 10 minutes from Sea World, and the Airport and only 15 minutes from the Zoo. A nice place the relax and to enjoy the view. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: BostonLobstah
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at Humphrey's and had a great time. We had a newly renovated Jr deluxe suite, which was huge and overlooked the marina. Great location, easy access to town and elsewhere by car. The walls were a bit thin and some of the ground floor rooms looked small with minimal amenities. The head concierge, Donna was marvelous and made our stay better with her knowledge and help. They need new recreational equipment and the fitness room is small. I can imagine that it might be a bit crazy there during the coincert season.

Reviews.Title: “Half Moon Half Rate”
Reviews.Author: Lukaran
Reviews.Content: Terrible room serviceâ€”was actually served food that we saw fallen on the ground outside and was not even dusted offâ€”even plate chips in the food! No accountability. We are SD natives and have used Half Moon for years even kept our boat there for 5 years. Great location, great concerts but, the Hotel and staff has gotten tired. There are better choices in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Great service, Nice location”
Reviews.Author: rbmotox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at Humphrey's. The hotel is located in a great area. Easy drive from the airport and away from traffic problems. I was amazed at how easy it was to go to Qualcomm stadium, Old Town, and the Gaslight area. At check in we asked for a room upgrade and were given the option of a poolside room on the bottom floor for the same price. The only stipulation was that it had two queen beds instead of one king. The room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was nicer than most. The desk staff was EXCELLENT. We took a couple of their "finest" bicycles out for a ride. Klunker bikes but still fun. We were so busy while we were there that we didn't really do anything else at the Hotel. Evening walks at the nearby beach were great. For what we paid, around 110. per night. This place is a great deal. If you don't like the room you get just ask for something different. We had a great time and have spent more for ALOT less!

Reviews.Title: “beat expectations”
Reviews.Author: TheArTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at Humphreyâ€™s. Everything I expected and more. I found a good price on the internet and the hotel matched it. We stayed in a â€œtraditionalâ€� ie cheaper room but it was all we needed. Clean, quiet and with features unexpected for the price like granite counters, refrigerator, morning paper and coffee in the room or lobby. The vaulted ceiling upstairs made it feel spacious. There was a free computer terminal in the lobby. The hotel is 2-story townhouse style in a circle around the pool and gardens. Facing the center is pleasant. The outer ring on the â€œbayâ€� side overlooks the parking lot and road before the bay. Upstairs probably has a good view but Iâ€™d advise against facing that direction. The other side, the â€œmarinaâ€� view is outstanding. Itâ€™s what I think of as San Diego. All you see are boats and seagulls with the city in the distance. It seems to be all suites on that side and we didnâ€™t need the added space or expense but itâ€™s probably worth the price. The suites are still much less expensive than similar rooms downtown. There are viewing areas with benches on that side perfect for reading or sipping coffee. The location is about 10 minutes drive from downtown. Thereâ€™s a free airport shuttle but youâ€™ll probably want a car. Thatâ€™s true in San Diego in general. There is free parking (uncommon). Across the street is a great place for a walk along the bay. The most impressive thing was the service. The staff made a point to ask several times if they could do anything to make the stay better. Being a tripadvisor addict, I usually donâ€™t use a concierge but Donna was so helpful and accessible in the lobby I couldnâ€™t resist. Overall it was a great stay and I wouldnâ€™t hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Tamsin72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading favorable reviews of the hotel here on Tripadvisor. I was able to find a rate of $101.15 per night on Expedia and I called Humphrey's directly and they were able to match that rate so I booked directly with them. That saved me from having to pay in advance with Expedia. I thought the hotel was awesome. I didn't ask for any room upgrades at all. The room I got was located by the sales office and it wasn't a marina view and it wasn't a garden view exactly. We were located in a corner unit facing another walkway with more rooms. I was steps from the marina though through a little walkway next to my room. If I went down the walkway it would take me to a nice bench area where I could read and look at the boats. I found the interior of the room to be excellent. I read somewhere here where someone called the property dated. I have to wonder if we were staying at the same place! I found it not to be "dated" in the least. It was modern and comfortable. The grounds were lucious and tropical and Tiki themed. The restaurant was nice for breakfast (also wondering where some of the negative reviews came from?!), the view was gorgeous. We even tried room service and found it conveninet. A paper was delivered every morning, we had internet access in our room via laptop or there was a shared computer with internet access and a printer located in the lobby that we could use. The hotel was EXTREMELY convenient to the airport and also to the convention center which is where my husband needed to be everyday. If and when I come to San Diego again I would not hesitate to stay here! This hotel was easily worth MORE than what I paid per night...now how many times in your life can you say that?

Reviews.Title: “Humphrey's is the Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all these reviews by people who don't like it. Granted it's not 5 star but it's on the Marina with a great view, close to the airport, it has a great heated pool and jacuzzi, ping pong, video games, and lawn crochet for entertainment and a nice pond in the back in a hawaian theme. It creates a relaxing atmosphere, and is very romantic. Their restaurant also turns into a bar at night where you can hear jazz etc... I ate breakfast at the restaurant 2x and it was spectacular, and overlooks the marina. I happened to go when there were no concerts but having concerts in the back is only a bonus! I'm going back this year, as for all the nay-sayers I hope you enjoy either paying double at the Marriott or enjoy the Comfort Inn. This is the best bang for the buck. The only thing i didn't like was that there are no elevators to get to the 2nd floor so i had to lug my bags up the stairs, which was a pain but a small price to pay for the best hotel this side of the Mississip.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: mjc01
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel near the airport and read good reviews. However, everything was just average including front desk service and rooms themselves. We initially were given a room facing the road but it was so dark and drab. We took a walk around the grounds and saw that the marina side had much better views. We requested a change of rooms and paid extra for the view and walked in to find we were given a suite w/ kitchen which was better. It was nice that they provide free airport shuttle. Overall it's an outdated hotel but convenient to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Humphry's Delivered”
Reviews.Author: NOLARocks
Reviews.Content: We also booked Humphrey's based on Tripadvisor reviews, and we did have some concerns that there might be noisy toilets and other signs of aging etc. We arrived late Christmas eve and didn't really get to see the place until the morning. It's an absolutely gorgeous hotel on the inside (the grounds), including the large heated pool and hot tub area (which my kids and I used a lot), but the front of the hotel is not special in any way. Some key points. The staff was very friendly and helpful our entire 8 night stay. Our room was clean, and the cleaning staff was prompt and almost never seen or heard. The room was large and had a nice layout with a dressing area where we could put lights on at night and not disturb sleeping family members. There was free high speed wireless Internet which I used every day. It worked great. Location. The location is excellent, and we didn't know this until we got settled in. There's a great local shopping center a couple of miles away where you can get anything you need, including a 24 hour Walgreens with everything at real world prices. It's up Shelter Island and right on Rosecrans. If you take Harbor Drive past the airport, you will get downtown in just a few minutes bypassing the 5 freeway. Up the street from the hotel is a local Mexican restaurant called Miguels. It has an excellent little bar and really good food. The hotel restaurant has a very, very good breakfast, and the dinner we had was good but not exceptional. The views at the restaurant were lovely. The pool area includes a ping pong table, putting green, and crocket area. The staff was always good about providing equipment, and the games were a nice diversion for my kids in between trips to Sea World and the Zoos, Old Town etc. Overall, the hotel was very warm, friendly, and clean, with a tropical motif that made us feel like we were in Hawaii again. There is live rock and jazz music every night, but we didn't see any of the shows. Wish we did. The restaurant is a Wine Spectator Award winner, and it did have a nice wine list with several good by the glass selections. Humphrey's really won us over.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: dkona
Reviews.Content: We booked on the basis of comments in Trip Advisor. We aren't sure why many reviewers are essentially "tripping over" each other to provide accolades for this hotel. It has aged. The "harbour view" room was on the first floor (but slightly elevated as the receptionist noted). (Between the hotel room and the harbour was the hotel parking lot, a street and a park parking lot, so you are not next to the water). Overall it was not the view we envisioned. The suite design was strange. The bed was located very close to the entrance door, and we had the privilege of overhearing several late night boisterous conversations in the hallway. Indeed the basics are there, a sitting room with a hard sofa bed, clean bathroom, a fairly clean room and a filty outdoor deck. The hotel is of course close to the water and waterfront park.So if you like to go for walks near the ocean it is a good location. However eating options (other than the hotel) are a bit of a walk from the hotel. Overall, if you are in San Diego to see the zoo, sea world and the wild animal park, it is better to find a lower cost hotel with safe clean rooms rather than one that also includes tropical ambience since since you would not likely take much advantage of the grounds the hotel has (for which you pay).

Reviews.Title: “Fair not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Humphrey's. Their internet prices are cheaper than if you call direct. Request a second floor room! Our first floor room had very poor soundproofing. There was a family with kids directly above us and the noise was horrible. We called to complain and the front desk said they could'nt do anything or complain until 11PM! On the good side, the location is great if you have a car. The views from the rooms are beautiful. Large pool and hawaiian motif was cute and unique. Skip the restaurant. Breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Had a really enjoyable time !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 weeks traveling around the US and for around $140 per night plus taxes this place was the best value for money hotel we stayed at. We had an early flight and had requested whether a room could be available before the normal check-in time. When we arrived (around 11am) our room was ready. The room was clean and had everything we needed â€“ the bed was very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful particularly with providing information/bookings for local attractions. There is a computer with free internet access in the lobby which was very handy for checking e-mails etc. The location on San Diego Bay is a beautiful spot. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Totally over rated!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in November and even though the weather not was very good, I found this hotel to be just average by any measure. For $179, our room faced the pool which has consumed by noisy teenagers. The rooms are old and you can hear everything! There was not auto check-out and because the front desk was under staffed, it took us 20minues! There was an awesome brunch. Location, though in the marina isn't within walking distance to tourist events. Overall, I was disappointed with this hotel and won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: devocheez
Reviews.Content: I took my son on his first trip to California. We stayed one night at Humphrey's and loved it!! The Temptations were playing the night we were there and it was just fabulous. The concert stage was right outside our hotel room door and we could stand right on the deck and watch the entire concert. The staff was very helpful in providing names of good restaurants to eat. We had room service for dinner and the food was good and fresh. The room was very clean and comfortable. Parking was good but we got back to the hotel well before the concert started. As people arrive for the concert, it fills up pretty fast and gets hectic outside the hotel. I would stay here again on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and really enjoyed our time here. We are four adults and shared a marina view suite, two of us used the put-you-up sofa which I have to say was not all that comfortable but everything else just made up for that. It was great to wake up and have breakfast on the patio looking at all the yachts just feet away. Didn't use the restaurant but ate at a great place up the road called Fiddlers Green. Shelter Island is a great place to stay and would definitely stay at Humphreys again if we ever get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: CHJBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in August 2005 and really enjoyed it. The check-in staff were extremely friendly and efficient. We had a room on the first floor overlooking the garden - better than the ground floor. We were a little concerned about noise having read previous reviews. Forget it. The room was quiet and very well appointed. Unless you go to bed before 10pm you won't be bothered by the outdoor concerts. The best bit about this hotel is the pool, it's wonderful. Never had trouble getting a lounger, it's open late and the poolstaff are great, especially the pool bar guys. And you get a free show on concert nights. OK, you can't see much but you can hear everything for free. So order a meal from the bar, get a marguerita and lie back and listen to the 'Doobies' or 'America' like we did. Also, we never had any problems with parking as suggested by some folk. Then again, we're British, so walking a couple of hundred yards (as we had to do on a single occasion) to our room wasn't a problem. Do Americans walk ANYWHERE. I must mention the restaurant which has one of the best views in San Diego. We had dinner one night which was good (great scallops) if a little pretentious. But the meal to go for here is breakfast. Sit by a huge picture window overlooking the marina and enjoy a great selection of breakfast goodies at very reasonable prices. I can recommend the corned beef hash with poached egg (to die for). The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of lots of good restaurants, only 10/15 minutes from downtown SD and the same to the beaches to the north.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: mainetoday
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed there last week for 2 days and got a really good deal to stay there. I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor and had canceled my previous reservation at another place, just to stay here. I'm glad we did!!! Upon check in, they gave me a free upgrade to a marina view room, overlooking their concert venue. Since we are in our 30's, we didn't mind listening to free concerts at night (Tony Bennett and the Pat Matheny Trio). I guess I can't complain, free concerts!!! These concerts were over by 10:30 or 11 PM, so this wasn't a problem for us. Anyways, the room was very clean and suited our needs. One of the concert staff even helped us carry our suitcases up to our room on the second floor (as there was no elevator) - he wouldn't even take a tip, that's service!!! We did order room service the first night and it wasn't too bad - it was convenient that they serve it until 10 PM. We did take a dip in their heated pool one day and sat in the hot tub for a bit. Everything was very clean and the surrounding were tropical. We loved the set up of this place and the tropical feel inside the resort area, vegetaition and koi ponds, definately a plus!!! If you are in the San Diego area and can get a good deal on a room here, it's definately worth it, Shelter Island was the perfect place to stay and was convenient to the San Diego Zoo, SeaWorld and downtown as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: subcycle
Reviews.Content: My husband & I met another couple at the hotel for a 4 night stay. We had a gift certificate for a Casablanca package and they had the same. We were both upgraded to rooms with a view of the concert venue which was wonderful and we didn't even have to ask! We were there for one of the concerts so this was an unexpected surprise. Our friends had some issues that were taken care of by the hotel quickly. Room service was very good on a busy concert night. The hotel is close to everything we wanted to do and to the airport. We all enjoyed our time very much and can't wait to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average with an attractive tropical setting. They catered for concert guests rather than their hotel guests. I was there with my husband and teenage son. On the day of arrival my son had just left his room to enjoy a swim. He was approached by a female member of staff who accused him of breaking a window. She was rude and attempted to bully him We did not receive an apology or an explaination. This spoiled our holiday We would certainly not return

Reviews.Title: “Half Moon Inn is my new favorite!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was just in town for the San Diego Music Awards and this was my first visit**It was so beautiful....the employees were friendly...the grounds were gorgeous and its right near the water!! And if you can be there to catch a concert ...even better! This was a trip I soon won't forget! I had a blast and by the way, I was traveling alone and felt very safe** You all rock Humphreys Half Moon Inn And a special shout out to my friend who helped me back to my room that night! Room 155...... Thanks! TAMI stewart

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel, nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: bethrad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property - it's visually appealing from the minute you drive up. I was frustrated at check-in, because while there seemed to be a few employees there, only one person was checking people in. It seems that they really like to take a lot of time with people when they check in (not your standard hand them your credit card and they hand you your room key kind of transaction. It's nice that they want to spend time with each person, but I waited about 20 minutes before it was my turn. I was very satisfied with my room - I thought it was modern and up-to-date, and nicely furnished. I had a view of the swimming pool area. The bathroom was nice, and had a nice array of shower/bath products. One thing I noticed was that if I was laying on the bed I could see a large gap between the entry door and the ground - I could see the ground outside. That creeped me out because who knows what could be crawling through there, but I didn't mention it to the hotel. A friend of mine was also staying at the property while I was there, and he was in the building that faces the stage in the concert area. His room didn't seem as nice as mine, but I can't really explain why I felt that way (seemed about the same size - different layout). His balcony was used by the sound crew during the concert, but no big deal because we weren't in the room at that time anyway. The service at the lounge on property was excellent - we had a specific request and they went out of their way to fulfill it, which we thought was really above and beyond standard hotel lounge service. We were very impressed. Overall, I really liked this property. It's beautifully landscaped and unique -doesn't feel like a regular hotel. I thought the service at checkin and checkout was slow, but other than that I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, Great atmoshpere”
Reviews.Author: CarlsbadTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Humphrey's overnight with a concert package. We had seen many concerts in years past, but this was the first time we decided to stay at the hotel. You definitely get the best seats in the house! We had booked two premium room packages as our friends from LA were joining us. We arrived early and luck was on our side, one of the rooms was ready, so we had a place to relax and wait for our guests. We were given a great junior suite with a view of the harbor and downtown San Diego. The layout was a little strange with the bed right by the door, but having the bar area and the living room and patio was great. Bed was nice a firm, which my husband loved, a little hard for me. Things were a little worn, but I was expecting worse from some of the reviews. Everything was really clean though. We had dinner in the restaurant. Food is good, but as we do the dinner/concert packages 3-4 times each summer, I wish the menu changed a little more often. Quality was good though and the service was awesome. Nice view too. We are going back for another concert in a couple weeks, booked the premium view suite package to get front row seats. I hope it is again, better than we expected and hoped for. Staff was very helpful and we loved the friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “dumpy place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at Humphrey's, we waited in a line to check in (as there was only one front desk attendant), and I watched as people were turned away because their rooms were not ready yet - the check in time is 4pm, and it was 3:30pm when we arrived. Once we got to the room, it was dark, dated, smelled like an old bar - complete with the stale smell of smoke - and just DIRTY. The bathroom had mold all over the shower/bath, and there was a steady stream of ants that marched through the room. There was also a wedding taking place at the time, so parts of the hotel were off limits, and the pool area was PACKED with people getting drunk. (I would suggest asking about events taking place at the hotel when booking the room) At $200/night, this place is absolutely not worth it. I would never stay here again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighs the bad”
Reviews.Author: holidaynut!
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from 23rd Aug to 28th August and prebooked with Virgin before we left the UK. It should be noted that the rooms allocated to Virgin guests are the standard non view rooms which was fine by us as it would have cost soooo much more for a view room. Also, compared to what the hotel was charging for rooms the Virgin price was a bargain. The hotel looks wonderful. The grounds are as everyone says, beautiful, although the rooms are basic. The room lighting was a little depressing and the bed linens and towels were rather old and you can hear the toilet flush and shower from the room above as if it is in your own room! However, we quite happily put up with these issues as the hotel does have such a nice, pleasant feel to it. The pool areas atmosphere changed on a daily basis. The day we arrived we got the impression it was a couples resort, everything silent with the odd couple lounging in the sun. However, it wasn't always like that. The hotel hosts weddings and on one of the days the guests were enjoying the pool for a few hours before the service. The pool was packed, lots of drinking,laughing, joking, and American football being played in the pool. We didn't have a problem with this at all. It was a good atmosphere. There is a table tennis by the pool also which the kids loved. By the way, the wedding was prepared beautifully and everything was arranged to look perfect, so if you are looking to have your wedding there I feel it would be an excellent choice. With regards to food, although we didn't eat in the hotel restraunt, we had a pizza at the poolside and we had to wait a very long time to receive it. It wasn't that good either. Although there were a couple of issues they would not stop us from staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent/But not worth $200 a night.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Humphreys (accross from Bali Hai in Point Loma) for three nights after staying at the Omni. The pool and garden area is very, very nice. The bar in the pool area is well stocked and the bartenders are very friendly. The location is very nice (point loma). You are near the bay-- within 1 block and can walk down the bay. Also a fishing pier is about 2 blocks away. Room service is nice and not that expensive. The hotel as a whole is about a 2.5 star hotel. The pool (with a large spa) is a 4 out of 5. So in summary: Pro's-- Nice pool, spa, and garden. Relatively inexpensive food (room service)-- good location (but not on the bay) - Nice staff, free coffee (in the lobby), near Bali Hai (if you are attending a wedding-which I was) Cons- The rooms are old and need to be updated, bad lighting in rooms, furniture and rugs (furnishings) are vey old, Concerts-- they have very loud concerts until 10:30 pm several nights a week, price-- not worth over $125 or $150 a night-- I paid 199 with partial view of the pool and garden Overall-- Worth it if you pay under $150 or under $125 a night Not worth it if you are paying 200 plus

Reviews.Title: “Very picturesque”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 10 days at the beginning of august 2005 and had a really good time. When we first arrived after a long flight from england and a 2 hour car trip down to San Diego from L.A airport we were very pleased to find that we had been upgraded to a ground level garden view room from our basic room for no extra cost. The room was pretty large with 2 double beds and a big bathroom, everything was very clean and well kept. As we were so tired and it was about 9pm we did the minimum of unpacking and went straight to bed so that we would be refreshed ready for our first day of the holiday, this was when we noticed that the toilet in our room seemed to be automatically trying to flush itsself every two minutes. We decided to endure it overnight and when we informed the hotel reception the next morning they were very helpful and apologetic and got a maintenance guy to fix it while we went out for the day. For the rest of our stay we had no other problems, the only other gripe was that the noise from rooms above us was audible and when the room directly above us used their water the pipes were quite noisy. This didnt bother us too much as we were out almost all day every day and from morning to late night. We also didnt hear much aircraft noise considering the nearness to the airport. The grounds of the hotel are of a high standard and the pool area is very lush and green. We ate at the hotel restaurant each morning for breakfast which provides a great view over shelter island marina. The food was great and reasonably priced and the service was almost always excellent. The location of the hotel on shelter island gives you some great views across the bay to San Diego and Coronado naval base. Getting down into San Diego was easy for us as we had a hire car for the duration of our stay and it was only a 15 minute drive away. Also there were a variety of restaurants and shops within walking distance of the hotel if you didnt feel like driving down to the gas lamp district. I would stay in this hotel again if i came to San Diego as for a 3 star i thought it was above average.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel but no better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading great reviews on Tripadvisor but found some aspects disappointing, whilst overall it was OK. Facilities are very limited. The only recreational activiites for kids are putting green, croquet lawn and pool. Even these limited faculities were removed during one and half days of our stay due to a wedding. The pool was outrageously cold which resulted in hardly anyone swimming during our entire stay. The concierge service was almost non existent and staff not able to help as they seemed to have limited local knowledge (eg where to park downtown). The hotel appeared preoccupied with the concerts which are staged nightly throughout summer. It seemd to be the #1 priority for staff. The rooms are OK with good aircon. However, becuase they are two storey wood-built construtions, they are noisy. We were often listening to peole in the rooms above walking around and doing what couples do on vacantion. Location not great. Only a small handful of local restaurants in walking distance but views of down town across the bay are great. Wouldn't return, but overall the hotel didn't spoil our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After paying a hefty amount for Humphreys half moon inn, I am sorry to say that I was completely underwhelmed by my time there, and felt I had wasted a lot of money. The room that i stayed in was small and dark and slightly depressing, I was told that I had been upgraded, from what, I shudder to think, it was clean enough, but again, I expected more for the money. The pool was small for the size of the complex, and I felt as though I had arrived at Butlins when i tried to get a lounger there, this was no sedate hideaway retreat, this was Butlins on acid, screaming kids and kevin the teenager. If, like me you were expecting a relaxing hideaway for a few days forget it, go there if you have kids, lots of money and don't get claustraphobia.

Reviews.Title: “Definately Come Here- you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a LONG time searching for a suitable hotel to stay in San Diego to suit the requirements of a family which included a 19year old boy and a 17 year old girl. we wanted somewhere that would accomodate 2 beds and a roll away as the boy and girl did'nt want to share.
